Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus they begin with the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by the completion of it you will achieve perfection in it, and by its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I have provided you with a treatment that is part of the operation of the hand, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation of the hand is prostrated in our region and in our time totally deprived, until the science of it has perished, and its practice is stopped; and there remain of it only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which made the most errors and deviations to those mistakes and excesses until the intentions of it are closed and its force is elongated and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revive it with the ordering of this treatise in the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it comes to the forms of the preparations of cauterization and of the other instruments of the work, as is necessary by addition of the declaration, and by preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why no artisan is found skilled in this art in our time, is that the art of medicine is long and requires its practitioner to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the joining of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and has the understanding of the bones, nerves and ligaments, and their names, and their functions; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and the places of their emission.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this Hippocrates said that a small word is enough, especially in the work of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of that in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said regarding anatomy, it is not surprising that they fall into error, through which men die, as has been seen many times, because some are formed in this science and boast of possessing it, yet lack its practice and experimentation.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish and inexperienced doctor having made an incision on a scrophulous abscess in the neck of a woman, and having cut some arteries of the neck, through which a great amount of blood flowed, until the woman fell dead among his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who ordered that he would swallow a stone of a man which was stuck in his throat, and the stone was large, and came to him and extracted that stone with a piece of the bladder, through which that man on the third day died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called it foolish to extract that, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I suspected that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who was paid by a duke of our land to perform surgery, and he applied a black plaster to a patient who had a fracture in their thigh; and the doctor, with his ignorance, extracted the fracture, put a poultice on the wound, with strong bandages and tight binding, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And return the dislocated according to the desires of the sick, and return the relaxed, and return the loose one for all joints and command that we untie the ligament; and it is necessary that thus between the thigh and the foot an abscess forms, and it comes to a dangerous loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And it is called relief for him, and prepared to dislocate the ligament, and acquired is tranquility and thus removed are his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	Greater corruption had already been confirmed in the member, for which it could not be restrained, and did not cease to spread the corruption in the member until the patient is in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who made a cancerous abscess, and it was ulcerated in the following days, until the evil of it was magnified with the lord of it, his master.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This is because the bitter humor is pure melancholy, then it does not happen that it comes to him with all iron, but rather that it be in a member which suffers so that from it all is hosted.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this, sons, it is necessary that the operation with the hand be divided into two devotions: one is the operation in which health is associated, and the other is the work in which danger is in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already extracted this from every place of this book in which an operation is described where there is error and fear; for which it is necessary for you to guard against this and let go of that, so that the foolish do not accuse you of speaking and dishonesty.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And then take up your arms with solicitude and protection from God, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God to achieve health and praiseworthy success, and leave behind the terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and put away your arms from what makes you fearful, so that it does not diminish your faith and your name: for many are remaining for your glory, and may they be in the world and afterwards among your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Indeed, I have already spoken to some wise men:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad illness poorly, so that bad doctors are not named".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already devoted this book to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first from the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the head and the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the preparations of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and perforation, and on ventoses, and on plasters, and on extraction of arrows and on similar things to them, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on treatment of twists and on similar things to them; chapter ordered from head to feet, and on the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and on sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is good to discern the quality of the juices of that cautery and of its instruments, and in which complication it is prohibited to apply cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the discourse on the quality of the juice of cautery and its instrument is a long and prolix discourse, subtle for science, and secretly hidden; and already many sages have spoken about it, and they are discordant, and for me it suffices to take a small part of their discourses, fearing prolivity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery is suitable for all universal complications, whether they are with material or without material, except for two complications, which are complications without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex of the tail and dry matter, it will become disordered; because some said that a cauterized wound is helpful for this, and others said the opposite, that cauterizing is not convenient for an illness which is caused by heat and dryness, since the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is convenient that an illness of the tail and dry matter be treated with what is hot and dry to be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And it is said by him who says the opposite, that cauterizing is made helpful in all dry and hot illnesses that occur in men's bodies, because when you compare men's bodies and their humidity to the complexity of fire, you find men's bodies are cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I speak from the sermon of that one, who has already experimented on me several times to discover.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I more openly declare that it is not necessary for that which has already been proven and practiced in the chapter of cauterizing through previous exercise, and having understood the diversity of the complexity of men and the disposition of their illnesses, and the causes of those, and the accidents of them, and the timing of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complexities, it is not about your fear, and especially in cold and humid illnesses, because already all doctors agree on those, and are not disordered in the help with cauterizing in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	It is known, sons, that the secret of curing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, is that a cautery in medicine is burning, because the fire is simple, its action does not reach except to the member which is cauterized and it doesn't harm another member near it but only with a small injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	More, the action of burning medicine reaches to that one in the members which is joined to it, and forces it to come into the sick member with difficult healing and forces it to be heard.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, by its subtle elevation and the goodness of its substance, does not make that which is superfluous; And it is known to us through experiment and through long duration of service in study of the art on the truth of the causes; and for this I am excused from the length of the sermon. And if it were not that my free will is bound by this secret, I would tell you about the fire, and the quality of its operation on bodies, and of its expulsion through which we expel sicknesses, in a philosophical demonstration, which would be acute in your understandings.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time in which it is convenient to do a cautery and they pause for the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the harm from the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of that which the cautery attracts, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and frequent, which do not suffer delay so that it is feared that evil will come, which is greater than small harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus it is not seen in your steps, or, sons, that they esteem only the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that for that illness which is healed by cautery, all time is not required, and they pause to consider that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not seen thus by them because they believe that cautery is only in place of medicine, which alters the complexion and dries the humors, which are the cause for which pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	More, I prefer cautery over medicine due to the will of its validity and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness returns at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of their illness, and the virtue of it, and that which is prepared in the body from the aggregation of superfluities in it, and that which has come to it through food and habits similar to those causes; but that the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and humors, thus as cautery of tooth for pain and similar to that, it is possible that in it the pain does not return, but rather it happens in a small place.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And most common speech is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is the speech of ignorant people, not because they understand it, but because they believe that there is no cure that can be achieved by medicine or any other cause except through cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is to the contrary of that; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not unless when we administer the ways of cure in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and then at the end of the cause, we administer cautery, and apply it to that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And therefore it is said that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the common people and many foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not burn, as it is not absolutely true, because it has been proven and found that it does not happen except in certain bodies besides the others, and cautery with it is good and better than with iron, as they said; but however when you make cautery with fire or gold, it is not declared to you, because it is ignited according to the quantity that you want for the roughness of the gold, and prepares to receive cold; and if you adjust it on the ember, the gold melts by the fire, and sometimes puts in the fire certain laminae so that the artisan can work with the occupation of it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, a cautery is made with iron, which we apply lightly and carefully to the rectitude of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head between the feet, so that I alleviate the demanding one what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for headache caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is opposed to humidity and cold on the service of the accidental one from which two causes are: it is a cause of swelling and multitude of flux, called rheumatism, of the head to the parts of the ears and of the hearing, and multitude of sleeping, and of toothache and of throat pain, and universally of all sickness that comes from cold, as well as paralysis, swelling, and apoplexy, and symptoms in those sicknesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this: that first we command the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine, for three or four nights, according to what the virtue of the sickness and the age of him and his custom require.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then make him sit between your hands on a wooden bench and place your hands on his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then stop the flow of your palm's root near the nose's root between the heels of the shoes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More emperor, when the said inner part is perforated, mark that place with a probe, and apply the olive-tree cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then stop that on the place immediately with a probe, in a manner that descends, in which the inner hand is constricted little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and examine the place, and if you see any part of the bone being uncovered to some extent, such as the quantity of a grain of barley, then lift your hand, and if it does not return to its former position, or if another part is cooled, until it is seen by the bone that which was said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the place and apply it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then stop on the cloth dipped in wax and apply it until the scar is destroyed by the fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with Tetrapharmacum ointment until it is healthy.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that the more the wound is opened, the better and more youthful the arm will be, for which it is better.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that some of them should have the tendon cauterized within the bone, and a cautery should be held within it so that a part of the bone's vitality is taken away.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then the part that is next to the bone should be scraped, and then it should be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they said that others should push the cautery from behind, so that it presses strongly into the bone, until the bone breaks, and this is the method of minor surgery:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, vapors of the head are expelled.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the open wound should be held for a long time, and then it should be cured until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But to me, these two species of cautery have not been seen, except in some men according to the way of fear; and that, it seems to me, is better for health, because the head is revealed by solution of continuity of the urine as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cautery is safer and better, it seems to me; and from that practice and in that work, health is obtained.
Capitol segon.	Chapter according to.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head there is chronic and long pain and it is prolonged in the patient, and it uses treatments such as purges and suppositories and poultices and plasters and dressings and bandages and liniments and remedies, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that does not help due to the lack of knowledge of those causes, then consider whether the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not frivolous and removes much cold, then that cautery is applied with another cautery, and place that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the horn of the sick head with a cautery in which the cord is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the cord and let it be uncovered by the bone the quantity that we have recounted, and cauterize that with a cautery in the right partition of the head, in the place which is called "vas" - and this is the place where the windy vessel is situated.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And raise your hand thus, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient through this will remove much diverse pain different from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery is in its place, because it is known that the cautery with which the horns of the head and the occiput are cauterized is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle place of the head is cauterized; and this is the method of it.
Capitol ters.	Head of the bed.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	From the cauterization of an old migrane.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain in the part of the head, or it is a sharp pain inside the eye, the head must be evacuated with evacuating medicine, and another cure administered, which has been mentioned in the treatises on illnesses; and this is not advisable, then cauterization can be done in two ways: either cauterization with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The best cauterization with burning medicine is that you take a piece of alum, and scrape it and apply the ends to both sides of the affected area.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then cut into the place of the pain in the temple with a sharp knife, so that it enters and the abscess is emptied out, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then tie above it with a bandage to constrict tightly, and leave that for three hours; and then untie it and extract the alum, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then apply a poultice on the affected area submerged in hot water until the place forms a scab.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with an ointment until it is healthy.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you see, make that with some medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on combining medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	We perform cauterization with iron in this manner: instructions for the cautery of which this is the method:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called clave or nail, because its head is like the shape of a nail in which there is some curvature, and in the middle part of it is a small protrusion.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it on the location of the pain, and hold your hand - so that the artery is not irritated, which is underneath - and move the small iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is irritated by the sharpness of the cauterization is as much as its size, then lift your hand so that the artery underneath is not irritated, so that there does not come a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak a cloth in salt water and apply it to the area, and leave it there for three days; and then apply a clean bandage, and treat it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see fit, cauterize at the extremity of the cutaneous tissue according to the cauterization, and beware of the incision of an artery in this migration properly not ancient.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat migraines with what we have said about previous treatments, and what we have said in the divisions of illnesses, and do not hasten the treatment, and sometimes because of the illness that is not enough what we have said about the first cauterization by medicine or by fire, then it is necessary that you apply the cauterizing iron, which has been purified, on the place of the pain along the line of longitude where the greatest pain is, or in that area; and place your hand for a while and firmly hold it while you make an incision in the artery and penetrate to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard the continuity of the jaw, which is hindered by chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerve which moves it, and that there is no spasmodic contraction.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood from the artery that is cut, for in the cutting of it there is fear, and especially for one who ignores what he does and is not careful and is reckless; then leave the operation to someone who begins.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will come with the reminder of the treatment of accidental bloody flux in the manner of the liver's custom, in its own proper place.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this sickness does not improve with this cautery and you see the patient's body tolerable, cauterize it in the middle of the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you want, administer the cautery that we have spoken of in the chapter on constriction of the liver with a cautery having two points, and this is a better cauterization and more beneficial.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of the pains of the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from cold and it is treated with laxative causes and with the other cure which has been said in the division, and the pain is not alleviated, then apply the cautery, and this is what is called a point, of which this is the method:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And apply the point near the ignition, and let it be carried around the entire ear as if it were rolled, or in a circle around whichever part the pain is in.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Bring the cautery to the root of the ear little by little until you feel the place with your finger.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of twelve points on the entire ear, and which one, then carefully cure the places between which they are healthy.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of the tortoise or turtle, but more likely it translates to: Of the ca
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tortoise, which is cured and with cauterization it is not except for the species that come from flux, according to what we have said in the divisions of the illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species that proceeds from dryness or from spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of tortoise with earth and purge and evacuations, and do not confirm your cure, then it is necessary that you cauterize the illness with three cauterizations: the first gives the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third gives the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply the cautery on the opposite of the affected part, because mollification is not seen except in the part that appears to be healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cautery on the right of the extremity of the ear, placed a little above the horn of the head, and in the temple another, the length of which should be according to the length of the aforementioned thumb, and place your hand with the cautery until it is burned the quantity of the weight of the species of the codena.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the shape of the cautery, and it is a specialty of the surgical knife, the shape of which is described in detail.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	More subtle is that which a little cuts the veins; and it is good to cut in the superfluous and gross part a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with what is previously described as a proven remedy for the disease.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said and it does not respond to your medication and the patient has no fever, then cauterize that with four cauteries: on all the horns of the head; and with a cautery in the middle place of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the handling of the cautery is done according to what has been previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized above the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and then it is healed with what has been proven.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization of oblivion caused by weakness.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is good to give to the patient at the beginning large pills and lozenges that purify the blood.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then raise the patient's head and place it on a plaster or poultice described in this treatise of plasters.

E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to the doctor's order which has already been stated.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And then if health is restored to him by this; and if not, then apply three cauteries on the back part of his head, which are dependent on the upper part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the thickness of the said bandage between each cauterization, and carefully treat the cauterized area with what has been prescribed.

Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it carefully until he is healed; and let the olive oil cauterization be according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of paralysis and of softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	As you proceed with the purification of the head with earth and with what we have said; and raise the head of the patient, and apply a cauterization on it in the middle place of the head, and cauterize above all the horns of the head, and cauterize above the back part of it, and apply three cauterizations on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the malady of mollification of the body with many sufferings and the malady is strong, then cauterize that with four cauteries on the spine of the back, and immediately with a cautery enter so that it is combined from the codena word of it, and elevate the third hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then return to cure that one so that it is healed, and this one will be cauterized with olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter ten.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not the epileptic who is cauterized, but rather that epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And thus it is fitting that you modify the brain of the patient at the beginning with years and with another cure, which we have dictated in the division when the malady is great and the exception of medicines is tolerated.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is an infant who does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargling and masticating servants to modify the service, giving that for many days, with improvement of the food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient, and then cauterize that with a cautery in the middle place of the head according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the occiput of it, and on each horn of the head let it be cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize them with the same cautery that was mentioned earlier, having previously softened and warmed the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the olive oil be cauterized according to what has been stated previously.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are rotten humidity and gross flaccidity, then cauterize them with the same cauteries that we have mentioned in regard to paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is a superfluous declination to melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give them a drink that purifies their brain according to what has been stated previously in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And rub the patient's head, and make a decently made plaster of egg on the circle, and apply it to the middle place of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated in a chair, and be held firmly from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And apply a plaster; it is also worthy to anoint around the eyebrows.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	He heats that on the hearth by tempered heating for measurement, which the said sufferer feels most in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then put that in the middle place on the head of it in the circle, and let it be inside so that it is refreshed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that to the patient for a whole week, with another regimen of it inside so that it is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that making small points according to the worse part of it, except that you hold your hand with a cautery thus ordered: this is a type of cautery which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply that cooked in butter or in broth of chicken.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter twelve.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of descending water in the thigh.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you the beginning of water in the thigh by the signs which I have already told you about in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient that which cleans the head of it, and keep it from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make it sweat in a bath for ten days.
