And then command it to shave its head, and cauterize that with a cautery in the middle place of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of rising of water in two thighs, or on one side if it is the beginning of water in one thigh.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make incisions with a cautery on all the veins and arteries that supply the kidney; and let the cauteries be in that length in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of flows of blood when it is being cauterized; and if you see any flow of blood, stop it with some medicine, which is within your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with wisdom, which is in the extraction of arteries and in the removal of those and caution of flows of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some times it is cauterized on the neck, where two bones have two cauteries applied to produce a good result.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and dirty, and through the veins and arteries which are in the obvious place of the head before and it is verified that this is an excess of hot and humid blood, then cauterize that with a cautery, which we have mentioned in the chapter on beginning of water falling into the eyes, and with a cautery in the middle place of the head and with two cauteries on the neck behind the two temples, and with two cauteries on the neck behind the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you indicate the addition, then cauterize that entire area of the heel on the extremity of the ankle with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of foul-smelling nasal discharge.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the patient with the remedy that we have mentioned in the division and do not press your treatment, then prepare it and give to the patient the decoction for three nights; and place a rag on their head, and cauterize them with a middle cautery or an olive-tree cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that area with a nail-shaped cautery or two cauteries above the two eyebrows, leaving a small amount of hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the acidity that you do not set that on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the nail-shaped cautery, this is its form.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization for the softening of the eyelids of the wheels (or possibly "eyes" or "ulcers", considering the context).
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery or this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that one on the two eyebrows with a small instrument of two cauteries in all divided areas, and they are lengthened from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cauteri be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cauteri too much, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is touched.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cauterization of the eyelid of the eye when the skins are converted to the internal parts and puncture the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skins of the eye are converted to the internal parts and thus puncture the eye, cauterize in them according to two manners, either with iron or with medicinal caustic.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with a hot iron, warn the patient beforehand that they should lift their skins like those who are cleaning them, until they are lengthened and widened; and if you puncture that one, then bind the eyes of theirs with a bandage so that it is not moved until the skins are reborn.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are reborn and widened, place the head of the patient on a pillow, and put a sign above the eyelid of their eyes with a tape, shaped like a fig leaf, and let this sign be according to the shape of the wound, and its beginning near the skins.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then stop the flow of blood in an abscess or in a swelling of pus under the skin.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then apply the cautery of which this is the shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize on the figure that has been marked, little by little, in repeated touches, until the surface of the cinder is completely burnt, so that it appears as a figment of myrtle, entirely open and visible.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	Sign of health in the said work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already being contracted and the pulses of it being elevated due to the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and then stop the flow of blood with a bandage until the wound is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that one with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the skin for some cause, then apply warmth and the eyelid is softened, then do another time the cautery on that one just as you did previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin grows onto the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is elevated to its own natural place and is smoothed out so that the skin does not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	Put the cautery in medicine to burn this is what is commanded to the patient that they lift their skins while they are extended and narrowed, and then make a paper of cloth in the shape of a woman's womb.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take soap made from congealed and living earthworm, or whatever that is, and mix those things together, and make a paste with celebration so that it is not chilled; and then spread that paste on the paper which is made thus in the shape of a woman's womb, and apply that to one side of the hip; and apply the other hip wrapped in a poultice of warm water, and let the head of the patient be in the same position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then put the finger on the medicine and press a little so that the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for this biting is to them like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then when they perceive that the medicine is biting, then remove the medicine and take it away from the finger; then when the biting stops, then wash the hip with water; and then consider if the eyelid is already lifted as if washed by the constriction of fire or incision, because this is what it is; and if not, return to the place where the medicine was not applied and do not neglect until the operation is completed and the hip is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then stop on the cut with a border until the knot of the adjustment is eradicated, and treat that one with a deafening ointment or another one inside until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, that your operation be with diligent vigilance so that no harm from the medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid after some days is softened and some cause of the pellets enters the eye, then apply your medicine on that place where the eyelid is softened, and properly as it was done at the beginning, and put in a wrapper so that it may be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of the mold for eye salve.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men are diversified according to size and smallness, and thus according to that your contraction is made.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let not be hidden the way of straightness to one who has studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of the fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the method that we have spoken of in the divisions of illnesses and do not confirm your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize it in this manner: order the patient to put their head back, and hold the head of the patient by some servant between the hands, in such a way that it is neither hidden nor agitated with the head back.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then apply a poultice made from the white of an egg or the mucilage of plantain on the wound of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery, of which this is the shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be hollow, such as the shape of a reed or the quill of a feather, on one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if it is necessary, let it penetrate to the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it come out like a tentacle.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But I consider that which is cooked is better for the said work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is opened, and draw out from it blood and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then make an incision on it and extract the purulence from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then apply on it the cautery which should be ignited, and you will hold the patient's hand with a little device to divert the attention from the pain to the nasal area, so that neither the hand nor the patient is disturbed, and then apply the cautery in the groin of the wound and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then if at the beginning of the application of the cautery you see it enter into the bone, that's good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and let it be like that for three days, and then apply on that place a dressing with oil and wrap it with a bandage exsiccative until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	More often if the disease has lasted eleven days and doesn't heal, then use medicine with a sharp corrosive effect until the bone is exposed and scraped according to what is convenient in this chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there's another method of cautery for fistula which some first authors described: put it in the place of the fistula and make a hole and return to that fissure with a subtle iron instrument, which is the shape of it: put in it the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and hold your hand around it with good retention, and don't let the patient move so that the melted lead doesn't penetrate to the hollow of that; and cover what you put on the hollow of the patient with cotton soaked in white of egg or in water, because lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it with marvelous sanitation.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about the cautery and the cure, it's good; and if not, then it's necessary to administer a tube through the nose and return the fistula to the body of the nose according to how it will fit in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the fracture of the feet.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Warts that appear as cracks in the lips, and especially on the lips of infants.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with the method that we have described in the divisions and do not deepen your treatment, then apply the small knife of the cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let the cavity of it be according to the subtlety of the cotella.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then gently push that knife carefully into those fissures until the point of the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with wax until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of the cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth an apostema is found and then it is broken, and then it is ulcerated, and then it is corroded, and a fistula is made, and then you treat that and do not deepen your treatment, then it is necessary that you apply cautery according to the quantity that has been received in the fistula, and then put that applied thing in the mouth of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the iron thing penetrates to the bottom of it, and afterwards make one or two openings; and then treat it with the method that we have described for treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And thus if the blood is separated and it is healthy, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and to remove the corrupted bone according to what will be said in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the cauterization of the teeth and the softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines and not cauterizations, then place the head of the patient in a sling, and prepare to apply the cauterization in the form that will be described later, so that you place the swab on the tooth and introduce into it the ignited cauterization iron, applying it firmly, and make a small opening so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth being penetrated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and apply the cauterization for a few seconds according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then let the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the decayed tooth is strengthened and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted humidity is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cauterization of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by cold or heat, or if medicine does not cure it, then cauterization is done in two ways: either cauterization with a cow's horn, or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with a cow's horn is that you take a cow's horn and boil it in a kettle of iron, and then take the cork and wrap it around the end of the stick, and then dip the boiled horn into it, and apply it to the painful tooth, holding it there until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip the wool or cork in the aforementioned cow's horn, and place it on the painful tooth, and place it on a hot iron until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But the greatest danger in cauterization with fire is that you pay attention to the size of the iron or rod, and it be in the core of some thickness so the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form of which it was found, and place it on the tooth and hold your hand there until the cautery cools; and do this several times until the pain is relieved, either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is proper that the patient should apply to their mouth the opening of a good pipe and hold it for one hour, and then return to scoop up; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you can extract according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cauterization of excesscences or tumors.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When excesscences are of phlegm and cold humors and are not obedient to digestion through medicines and you want the digestion of those lightly, then you ignite the cautery in the form of which is this following, having two extremites covered so that the smoke of the cautery goes through the other extremitate, and apply that ignited thing on that apostema once, and another time if it is necessary for that, until it reaches the bottom of the apostema.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the apostema is small, then apply the cautery according to the quantity of the apostema, and return it for three days and apply on it a dressing in good wax until what the fire has burnt is renewed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with plasters and bandages and dressings until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the cannula or of the cautery is such that it serves to convey.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of the throat and of narrowing of the spleen or perhaps "Of cauterization of the throat and constriction of the spleen" or better:  "About cauterizing the
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes upon the channel of the lung, and especially when it is mixed with coldness of complexion, then it is seen that the patient should be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the vein at the root of the throat in the affected area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And beware that you do not touch the throat with the cautery nor press on the patient's spine except a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize it with another cautery at the joint of the neck on the patient's last vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery of it should be done in the manner described previously.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with that which has been prepared, until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cauterization of lung disease and of coughs.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are from cold humidities and the patient has no fever nor wasting, and it is an ancient disease, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the furcula in the affected areas of the lungs and liver; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest between the two breasts; and let the cautery be done according to the previous method.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas. De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of the perforation of the abscess of the liver with a cautery.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of the cauterization of ulcers.

Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of the cauterization of fistulas that are made in the rectum, in the lower parts of the body.

E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place where it was injured.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and its matters are separated from it, and it rests thus for a long time, then you will know that it has been cured entirely.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matters are not removed from it, then you will know that it is penetrating or in the press of its bone corrupted, or this comes from those causes which will bring recollection to their place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of the cauterization of the kidneys.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the kidneys there is pain due to cold or due to great abundance, and thus the cotyle of the patient is constricted, then it is fitting that you cauterize over the kidneys with a cautery on each kidney with a sharp-pointed cautery, by which the recollection will be pressed.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And strengthen the cautery on the second with a small hold, so that three linear cauteries will come, and thus they will serve as more recent aids in healing.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On the cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When weakness and softening occur in the bladder due to cold and humidity, so that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize that area and place a dressing on the bladder, where the skin of the perineum begins, and cauterize with a cautery on the right side of it, and with another on the left side.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat. E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let the cautery be applied to the hip bone as needed.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cauterization of the uterus.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When cold and humidity come to the uterus, and because of this conception is prohibited, and the menses of it are corrupted, and the flow of them is delayed, and pain occurs in the abdomen, then it is necessary that the area be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said regarding the bladder; and with a cautery on the lowest part of the back, or with two cauteries, and let the cautery be applied to the hip bone.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter forty.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist humors accumulate at the ankle joint, and are the cause of the swelling in that place, it is a sign that one thigh is longer than the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is found in which way it is bent.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore, you should cauterize the patient on the ankle joint with a circular cautery, because you will have felt with your hand in the circuit of the joint as it is turned, and so that the joint falls in the middle place of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And let this cautery be of the type which follows the form in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not at your disposal, then cauterize with three irons and an olive-shaped cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And let the cautery be made according to the quantity of the thickness of the entire cord; and take care that which enters is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter forty-one.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the ankle joint, and it is caused by cold and humidity, the patient is treated with what we have said before and it does not help, and this is ancient, therefore you should treat the patient with gross humors with fetid or artificial plasters; and then cauterize.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The handling of the cautery in this case is according to two methods: either a cautery with burning medicines or a cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It will be according to two scientific methods, of which one is that it cauterizes the area on the side of the patient with three triangular cauteries, in this form; and do so with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space between each cautery be the amount of the thickness of the finger, and if the olive or grain-sized cautery.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	More often the cautery is placed on the middle location on the head of the ankle for which there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena. E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cautery in cases where pain is adhering to the ankle and is not extended into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended into the thigh, then cauterize with two cauteries on the thigh at the location where you find the patient who has the pain; and with one cautery on the hip, a little below the pubic area.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery cuts, then its depth should be according to the quantity of the spasm of the tendon.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient complains that the pain is extended to the area proper to the toes of the feet, then cauterize that place where it hurts with a cautery for three points or four or more if indicated by that.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient complains of pain being in the knee towards the thigh, then cauterize that place with a sharp-pointed cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And beware in all cauterization that you do not touch with the cautery so as to harm a nerve or a large artery, and that because of this you cause evil to the patient, an inconvenient or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have already seen one and another of those whom I have cauterized on the hip and finished with the cauterization, and the leg became swollen within which the tumor reached the foot, and it became perforated and corrupted the whole foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then follows a strong flux of belly, and then comes death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts at the same time, cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise men say in the cauterization of this cautery, that the method is: make a figure like a circle of iron, whose circumference is the size of a palm; and let it be hollow according to the thickness of a date stone or a little finger.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let that circle be another thumb; and let the space be the amount of the knot of the foot; and let those circles be divided into two parts; and let the length of those chains be a knot or two knots, and make in their margin a decently dressed iron in the circles; and this is the shape of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then let it be ignited in the fire until it wraps and sparks, and then place it on the affected part of the ankle, the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And thus cauterize that wound with three cauteries applied in a single occasion.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it for three days; then plaster that wound with paste and leave the open wound for many days; and thus cure it with ointment until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Says Albucasis: Oh, sons, of this type of cautery we have made little use due to fear of its management, and because we have found few that take care of it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	Worse than the cauteries is he who suffers them, and it is even worse for him in the place where it is applied.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	A worse cauterization in medicine is that you make two circles having an armula with a perforation in which the iron hook of the door would fit; let the length of the partition be on the narrowness of them, being two knots or chains those.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space which exists between each of the quantities of the thickness of the said thing; and they are opened underneath and above, and they contain themselves between them according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then stop on the part of the ill person's flank, and press your hand on the part of the flank; and take warm water and put it between two cloths, and the quality of that should be with a small fire, a little at a time, and apply that for the quantity of an hour, and let the patient suffer the biting and adjustment of it — because that burning bites like fire — until the biting stops.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then lift your hand with the instrument and wipe away the warm water from all the flank with cold water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then let it be for three days and stop on that bandage until the blackness of the adjusted wound is cleaned, and let it be for several days, and beware of its putrefaction; this is necessary in treatment.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with an ointment until it is healthy.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends to the thigh or the leg, make a plaster for it that contains water according to what is done in the aforementioned ointment.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of hot water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the correction of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkaline and non-extinguished lime, take a part of it, divide it into three, and put it in a new pot, from which the part will be perforated by a small hole, according to the quantity that enters into the container.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And put the bottom of one pot into another covered pot, and pour over that alkaline and living lime sweet water which takes those with a finger, and once you have compressed them well with your hand for good compression, and release the pot that separates the sharp water from the part in the covered pot.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water, and pour it over another living lime and other renewed alkaline, because that water will then be strongly acidic, which is administered in many operations of medicine and in cauterization of the other members, for the operation makes a burning.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And of medicines some are those with which it is cauterized, such as vitriol and honey and lime mixed together with soap, so that they are mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Galen recounts of one of the ancients the operation and the cure with which is cured pain of water and of vein sciatica, and magnifies much to be of that, and says that there is no need for another cure, and that it is healed by a single glance, just as he recommends, because the man went into a bath and was already healthy before that.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that a plaster of vert is applied, and if no vert is found, then a recent figua is applied; and the mixture is triturated with a few grains and placed on the ankle where the pain is, or on the thigh, or on the leg, and is tied.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for a duration of three hours or for the amount of time that the patient feels relief from the adjustment.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put him in a bath and when his body is sweating, rub him on the ground, for the pain ceases and it is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And be aware that it's not suitable to use a cautery with these medicines, but rather the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	Moreover, Escorides said that when the strict vein of the goat is cauterized, it benefits him; and let the cautery be done in this manner: take a wool and dip it in ancient oil, and place it between the toes of the foot and between the fingers.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take dry goat's fat and melt it in fire until it becomes charcoal; and put it on the wool and squeeze it in so that it is absorbed.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this, and do not stop doing it until the sensation of the biting reaches the water and relieves the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this manner of cautery is called cow's cautery.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cauterization of pain of teeth.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Some pains in the back are due to many causes, such as a fall or a blow or excessive evacuation, and for similar reasons, from an infusion of humid and cold matter.

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of the cauterization of gout and of joint pain.

E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pains push close to the joints or the muscles, then cauterize all the parts of the helpers.

Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 44.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of the cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a fracture occurs in the limbs and intestines protrude from the wound, and this is a common beginning, then command the patient to leave their food for that day and to use gentle laxatives so that the wound of their belly may be evacuated.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then follow the patient with your hands on their back, and command them to hold their arms inside so that the intestines or the wound are not protruding outward.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return to the thighs of the patient and examine the rupture on the bone of the pelvis with a sign that shows the extremity of which is similar to the majority of circle at the upper divided parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply the cautery, the shape of which is this:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Into the area where there is a lot of movement and sweating, tie bandages.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	And you have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, and placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then cauterize the area with your hand holding the cautery upright, and in that place where you feel the bone of the patient's ankle in the middle of the joint; and if you did not succeed with the first attempt, try again.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And be careful with the movement of the intestine during the time of your cauterization, so that you do not harm it, lest the patient suffer death or some other great evil.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you have the cautery, if you do not touch the bone, your operation will not be successful.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is fitting that the cautery for children be subtle according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And then treat the area of the cautery for three days with a poultice until the scar is formed by the heat.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that one with the other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient sit on the seat for forty days until the place and the wound are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And give that one nourishment according to the length of time of their treatment, which will cleanse the belly of theirs, and so that the intestine does not come out due to the effort of straining.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when it is time to get up, administer a gentle decent treatment, and keep that one for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let it be spared from work and from abundance of food and drink, and from violent vomiting, for when one uses this regimen of complete healing they will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And we will describe the treatment of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and so from the beginning, and you want that they not protrude, then cauterize the rupture of that one with a heated cautery according to its quantity, and let it be that which is exuded from the coding, thus as the third part of it; and then treat that one with what we have said, and it will not be out of place.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And we have already said that some first rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is done with a tent.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is customary to make a line with the cautery along the width of the wound, and another line on the bottom; and place your hand with a clavical cautery, but the first cautery is put more lightly and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of the throat.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain enters the limbs through a blow or a shock and the pain persists for a long time and does not respond to medical treatment, then it is advisable to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And let the cautery be of the whole limb according to its size and smallness, and virtue and weakness, and location of the throat and pain of it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is healed by the first cautery, it is good; and if not, then apply the cautery to it again; for it is customary with those pains that they be punctured in the limb next to the one to which it is closest, so that it seems that the patient will be healed with the cautery.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers are sometimes treated with a cautery for great youthful humor, and more so if the type of leprosy is caused by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you want to cauterize that person, consider if the leprosy is contagious and if it can be cured with what we have said in the division and do not neglect this, and be afraid of the corruption that comprehends the entire body and its entirety, then cauterize the person on the head with 5 cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and another at the back of their neck, and on the forehead to the end of the hair; and two on the horns; and one behind, on the nape or servico.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally put your hand on the cautery a little inside so that it presses on the bone a small impression, and from this the dislocated ribs are rearranged, so that the expiration of thick vapors is alleviated; and cauterize on the middle as it is prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then it is seen that you should cauterize them with those cauteries which we have mentioned on the head; and put a cautery on the tip of the nose, and two cauteries on the two clavicles, and two cauteries on two vertebrae of the neck, and six cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one on the vertebrae near the hip, and one on the hip, and two on the shoulders, and one on each shoulder, and two on the elbows, and one on each elbow, and two on the knees, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of the sixth rib; and cauterize them on all the joints of the arms and hands, and on each heel of their feet, and on the soles of their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves that are on the sole, so you don't damage them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And in some cases it is cauterized with a cautery on the bone of the penis and with another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more you adjust the cauteries, the more beneficial and effective they are; and know that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery, as they do from other things, because the body of the patient is already stunned.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And it is fitting that the cauteries are large or small according to the limbs and the joints, as it is determined by the species of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the cautery with flour of toasted rushes and with honey, and with another remedy until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	Of the cauterization of numbness or stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is numb or dormant and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and is not healed, then you cauterize that numb limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let the cautery enter the depth of the skin a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that wound with an ointment that is healthy.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And certain areas are cauterized, which causes numbness to the hands and feet, and the vertebrae of the back and gives movement to the nerves which govern that member, and the numbness is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not touch that except for one who is knowledgeable in the anatomy of the members and of the exit of the nerves throughout the whole moving body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of ulcers that cause mortification.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When an ulcer is old and does not respond to the ointments of medicine, then you cauterize it with a pointed cautery, taking a little according to the quantity of the acidity of the body in which the whiteness and the color of it are restored, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that wound with a flour of oats and of lentils mixed with rose oil and with leaves of arnagrosa, and with blood of pigeon or blood of curlew, each one a part and all mixed together, and then apply it as a plaster on the area, and place it so that it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cauterization of cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is suspected and you want to treat it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around the area of the affected part as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise men say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle place; but to me it is not seen as such, because I fear that it will be ulcerated, and I have already seen this many times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is better to cauterize around the area in a circle as we have said, or with multiple small cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of cauterization of swelling.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some swelling is delayed in maturation, and this is due to excess of humor, or because of the age of the patient, who is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of the time, and you want to hasten the maturation of the swelling; then cauterize around it with many small cauteries, making small punctures; and immediately apply a poultice that will promote maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to make a perforation with the cautery, then ignite the cautery of which this is the shape: and apply it to the middle place of the swelling until it penetrates the skin.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is applied in that place where it was put, so that the body of the arm is alleviated; then return to cure that which is injured.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter (or Headings/Title) Four.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of the cauterization with corrosives.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosive is a wandering corruption in the member, which corrodes that thus as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Then if you apply that corrosive in the place where it suffered from the cautery by fire, then you will ignite cauteries of small nails, and large ones as is convenient in that place where there is corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize the entire affected part, so that you eradicate all the corrosion and do not leave any cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let it be for three days, and apply on the cauterized places a dressing with oil mixed so that the scars are all eradicated and all corruption.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then heal it with an ointment that generates flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days the flesh is born healthy in which there is no corruption, that's good; but if not, then repeat the cautery on that which is rotten in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	They corrode with medication certain wounds of sharp medicine, for that is a substitute in place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	It is better to apply cautery on the focus of the pus rather than to evacuate it gently.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the treatment of it with sharp medicine in division, and therefore take that which of its humors is deficient.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 3.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	Of the cauterization of the claws and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Moor or tumor is found at the joints of the foot of the sick person who has a claw, and it is a thick, swollen cause, which hurts the foot; and cautery in these cases is done in two ways, that is, cautery with fire and cautery with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Better is cautery with fire, that you shape the cautery iron similar to a pen for writing, which should be made of iron according to the quantity that the claw contains in its entire joint, and it should have subtle edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then apply the ignited iron to the claw, and then turn your hand with the cautery in the circumference of the claw until the cautery penetrates to the depth of the claw.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it like that for three days until it starts to form a scab.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made from ground marsh salvage mixed with salt, and leave the plaster on for nine nights, so that it will eradicate the roots of the ailment.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the area with an ointment made from generated flesh, so that it will be sanitized.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and you see inflamed pimples on the surface of the body, mainly on the hands and feet, then take a cautery iron and dip it in water, and it is that you grab a needle of iron or of stone or of pumice, and place it on the nail; and then put a small quantity of hot water into the needle, and hold your hand, and you rotate it with compression of your hand, and be pressing the edge of the needle on the root of the nail, and introduce the hot water through the pressure of the root of the nail; and let the patient wait a little for the penetration of the hot water for one hour, and then remove it, so that the nail with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do the same on the other one and then come out all over the places of the body where they are.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then heal those areas where the roots of the nails have been eradicated with an ointment that generates flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter Three.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of the cauterization of trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you have a patient with trembling caused by cold in the nerves or by fever of a similar cause, then it is customary to cauterize them with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra a cauteri; and a cauteri on their chest, and another on their stomach, with an olive tree cauteri.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of theirs is relieved and the health of the cold disease is restored.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter Five.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of the cauterization of accidental ulcers on the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When on the body there are spotty ulcers, and there are pustules or fissures which are made from gross corrupted matter; then it is customary at the beginning of the treatment to make an appearance, that it should be cauterized over every head of the fistula with a subtle cauteri of burned mint, whose extremity is extended with fire; or with a long cauteri of aristology; or with a slow-burning cauteri.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And some wounds are cauterized with a mixture at the beginning of their expulsion in this manner; and they are not believed to be cured, and the excess is broken up, making them healthy by removing those things.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	May the emperor command that this be done with proper evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of cauterization of accidental bloody flux by incision of the artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Treatments applied to the flux of the artery that is cut by the wound, which applies from the beginning of the pain, or from the incision of abscesses or cauterization of the limb, and it seems similar, and it is difficult to remove that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when it happens to someone, then you must cut with your hand at the orifice of the artery, and press on that spot with your finger so that the vein is constricted and the treatments entered, so that the flux of blood is stopped, and does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then apply the hot irons to the spots of the cauterizations, which are called "moxa" by name, and blow on them so that they are ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from them a small or large thread of the location and the wound in which the artery is broken, and apply it to the vein, firmly holding that you have constricted with your finger, and sew the cauterization so that it is bound and restrained, the blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you touch the vein and extract the cautery, then take another cautery carefully from the cauteries that are prepared in the fire, and thus do not cease to do this until the blood is constricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you do not injure the nerve that is here, and let another evil come upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.
