And be aware that when a lot of blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to constrict the blood in those cases, and especially when the artery is large, unless one of four methods is used: either with a cautery as mentioned before, or with extraction when it has not been extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities of the veins are injured and the blood is constricted; or that it be tied with a thread or ligature for strong constriction, or that medicaments be applied to them, whose virtue is to constrict the blood; and they be bound with a bandage or with a tight binding.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	More so, he who administers a proper constriction with a ligature and binding, or with cloths, by means of applying causes that constrict and of similar things, does not do harm but rather benefit.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If the doctor is not present and no medicine is being administered, then treat with caution according to the indications for the orifice of that vein as we have described, and understand the great constriction within which the blood is blocked from the upper part of the wound, and above the scar the aforementioned should not be removed; and from above the scar apply cold water of great chilliness so that the blood congeals and coagulates; and also consider whether cauterization or medicinal treatment is necessary.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and of vein cuttings and of phlebotomy and of wounds and of their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the teachings of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the ailments in which a cautery with fire is convenient and with medicine combustible, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for them with the forms of the cauteries; and we have ordered the chapters concerning the treatment from the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will proceed in this chapter with that medical method, by which the one seeking it may be alleviated, namely, concerning what has been asked for.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	It seems that you should commence this lesson, cave, sons, so that you may learn what in this chapter is by fear that which is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And by that which it is necessary to be in great caution, because in the operation which is in this chapter many things are considered evacuation which is with blood and in which life depends on the aspersion of the vein or incision over the postema or perception of exiture or purification of the wound or extraction of arrow or incision of the flesh and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all those things are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in their hands there is death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you does not fall that which is destruction, because some times it happens that you will treat men with many manners of evils.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them there is one who will rush to their illness and will hasten their death, and thus by the vehemence of that which he finds in his illness, and by the length of his illness, and with the illness is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those there is one who gives you to have hope and speech, you hoping for health, and their illness is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to that which is shown to you by one who is of this manner; and let your caution be greater than credulity and your rashness; and do not presume any cause concerning this except through certain science, which proves what you must believe, and to which successful experience gives testimony.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use it in the cure of all your patients for prognosis and indication to him who is health converted, because in that you are helped regarding acquisition of fame and of memory, of praise and of glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, may God inspire your understanding and grant you direction and protection, for this is in His hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have written and ordered this chapter distinctly by chapters as it precedes in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure from head to feet, so that may be alleviated for you what you demand of it and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the treatment of water that is contained in the heads of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often seen in infants must be given to the infants and when the nurse tightens the head of the infant, it relieves the swelling.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some times it happens for a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have not seen this illness except in children; and all those who I have seen with it, I have covered their death, and thus for me it has been a sad work on them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water, and the head of it was so magnified that one could not see itself due to the greatness of its head, and more that the humidity had increased until fatal heat.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is collected between the cartilage and the bone, or is collected under the bone on the vertex of the head.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation on this case where the humidity is between the cartilage and the bone and the abscess is small, it is necessary that you make an incision in the middle of the head with a fissure in width, and let the length of the fissure be two nuts so that the humidity can flow, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And then if the humidity is more increased and the abscess is larger, there are here two incisions in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is under the bone, the sign of it is that you see the sutures of the head swollen on all parts and the water is squeezed out when you press it with your hand on the separated parts and it does not come back to its original place.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Make sure you sew in the middle place of the head with three sutures according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract all the humidity from the incision; and tighten the sutures with bandages and plasters; and apply an ointment of wine and oil onto it until the fifth day, and then dissolve the ligature and cure the wound with tents and poultices, and tie the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which considers how to open the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of the water, because some times it is more in the occipital bone, or in the front part, or on the right side, or on the left side; and so you should do the incision where the abscess and the collection of water appear, and do it according to what is most possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And be careful not to cut the artery and do not let the flow of blood and humors, because it will kill the patient due to that flow of blood with evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called Hilassesse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When something reaches to certain colds or rheumatisms the lungs or the chest, and it is antiquated, and doctors do not agree on this cure, then the last cure in this case is the beginning of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And then cover when you want to incise those that the patient's vein makes near the head, and rub the area with rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and hold the patient's neck with a cloth; and consider on the pulse the vein; and the places of each one on the places which are near the ears being pressed, and so hide themselves in some homes.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark the artery with a needle, and incise each one on the edge of each partition near the incision that enters into the bone, and let that be through the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, introduce the spatula under the artery and cut it to the incisions of the aforementioned parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be two digits adjusted, because when any vein is incised, the blood exits with pulsating egression, which often escapes with frequent beating.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	If the spleen does not appear in the cincture, then take the measure of the width of three fingers from the auricle, and apply the sign with a tent, and enter into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which is taken from the blood is a quantity of twenty units, and take it from the patient's urine or blood, and all that is according to the quantity that appears from the virtue of the patient and from the replenishment of the spleen of theirs.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and if there remains on the bone any cause of the disease, then cut it out so that no abscess or gatherings form.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with dressings and with bindings of clean cloth, and cure it with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter three.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the spleens which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When to some it happens that an old or chronic humor falls, through humid and agrimonious qualities in the sides of the temples, or a violent and vehement pain, and it is treated with the manners of medical cure and this does not alleviate, then we have spoken about the extraction of the spleens in the temples, or cauterization of those thus as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	The handling of the operation and extraction of those things is that the patient scratches the skin which is in the temples; and understand the apparent artery in the temple where it is shown to you by the pulse, and is hidden except in few men due to violence of cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then stretch the patient's neck with some cloth; and rub the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with hot water so that the artery appears to you manifestly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then take the spatulum of which this is the shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then scrape the cord with that which will facilitate entry so that you reach the artery; and then cut in one side and extract that from the superior parts so that you extract that from the cord and discover that of the tunics which were covering it, of the entire partition.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then envelop that with the extremity of the instrument, and then incise from that one partition according to the quantity for which the extremities of it are lengthened and contracted, and do not find a flow of blood, because if they are not incised, the blood will not flow at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood of the vein that enters the thigh.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the wound is large, then it is necessary to tie it in two places with double thread of hemp or with cords at length, and do not allow putrefaction to occur before consolidation of the wound and a flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut away the excess which is between two ligaments; and do this at that hour or at another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize that with a cautery iron within the bone with a cutting cautery iron where the extremities of it are cut, and it will stay in place of that half-healed wound.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better to do this if the patient has fever or is of a hot complexion; for cautery is one of those things that helps with finishing humors, and therefore it is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then it is necessary to extract the varices that fill the space of an old ulcer, and let them be treated with dust decently made, and then let it be cured with dry medicines that make flesh grow and with poultices within which it will be healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are working another vein is found with a flow of blood from the wound, then restrain that blood, either with a cautery or by filling the space of the cut, and press your hand within to constrict the blood.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if the cause of those things is not present to you, then apply a warm cloth over the area until the blood is congealed, and wet the area with water of vehement coldness until the acute pain subsides, and be strengthened according to what is suitable.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is easier in extraction of acidity is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two points, since you have seared the two areas with a thread, and applied it to each spot, without moving, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two spots, so that what is between the extremities of it, which are not consolidated at all with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	The sharpness of the two points should be equal.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	It is better if the sharpness of one point is greater than the two, because if they are too pointed and close to each other, it will not cut the flesh with speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, when there is some thickness in those, the heat of the fire is held on them and the flesh is cut more easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better than all works and also easier.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space be that which is between two hips the quantity of the thickness of the said.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure for bodies with acute and acidic rheums of the wheels ( possibly referring to the eyes, or more likely the joints).
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are acidic rheums, and it is the body of those veins which are on the head, and they do not converge in any cause for the cure of medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient already turns red and feels like walking as if it were a walk of ants, and the wheels (joints) of that one are so weakened, humidified in such a way that already their skin is constricted, and the eyelids are scratched by the acidity of tears, the ancient bitter mixtures used in the cure of those of this operation, I call that cure a waste.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to raise the skin which is on their forehead, and then insert three distant grooves on the forehead equally spaced according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the groove is two fingers: one groove is equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle place of the forehead, and the second according to the length a little above the movement of the tears which are in the tear duct, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	Be careful at the beginning of the arthritis which is located in two sides, and stretch your hand from the continuity of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each injection requires the quantity of three fingers adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge applied or dry cloths moistened with which to dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	Then insert the spatula between the two pointed extremities, of which this is the form of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the separation of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape away from that all the cartilage which is between two incisions around the zygoma, which is above the bone, and then make this from the middle incision to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then pull this spatula and insert into the first incision another tool which is called a chisel, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And push the edge of that sharp tool between the flesh attached to the cartilage, and the edge of it within the bone, and drive it in so that it reaches the middle fissure, and cut away all the vessels that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	It seems that the incision should be continued in this apparent cavity of the coda, and then make it in the middle fissure entering into the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And then purge the blood of a certain quantity, express the places of the veins of the congealed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then apply a poultice on each warm fissure of old cot, and put it on those inflamed and wrapped in wax and oil and sharp vinegar, and beware that the apostema does not develop into an ulcer.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day dissolve the ligature and administer a large infusion of hot water or tea, and then cure it with an ointment made from basilicon and oil and rosewater and other things so that the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of pains caused by cataracts and descending humors from the divisions of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When one has cataracts that are sharp and continuous, and the humors of the patient are attenuated and small, and already their regard is weak, and the eyelids are ulcerated and from them come pus, and in the forehead of the head there is sharp pain and extrusion as a consequence, then you will know by this accident that the materials and cataracts do not come except from many veins of the divisions of the interior proceeding.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for those is this: that you command the patient to shave their forehead, and make an incision in the middle of it, a small one for the width (and start from the left temple's incision towards the right temple; and let it be an incision through the bone; and stretch out your hand with the fingers of the temples which are weakened by chewing), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or with dry cloth and fill in between the two lips of the incision with old cloth or with bandages.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strew dust made from vine or oil over it so that there does not develop a post-cautery abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has diminished, then it is time to scrape the bone until new flesh begins to grow, and treat it with a drying regimen which makes the flesh heal, just as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of collofonium and mix them, and from this make a plaster and administer it on these wounds of born flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the cure of that which falls into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The entire cause that falls into the ears is one of four species, either it is mineral pebbles or similar to pebbles, such as iron and copper, or it is from plants such as seeds or beans, or it is a fluxing cause such as water and bitter vinegar and its similars, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And then when pebbles fall into the ear or another similar cause from those causes that do not adjust in the ear, and stop the ear with the sun, and if you shake the pebble, it is distilled by some oil of violet or sisam, and then administer the extraction of it, and make the patient sneeze with condition, and stop the nostrils for fear of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then put in the ear canal some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to its separated parts, because moist heat is introduced with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not introduced, then administer extraction of it with the instrument called fine forceps, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is introduced with forceps, well; and if not, then administer the extraction of it with a fine hook of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not pierced by that, make a needle of iron and insert the extremity of the needle into the hole of the ear and close around the environment of the needle with wax and oil softened so that it does not come out except the needle.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract strongly with the finger pressure, for the mucus accumulated with that which we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	More if it is not pierced in this manner, then take of alum or prepared vinegar and with which the soles are pressed a small quantity, and place that on the extremity of the vein, and then wrap over that place decently.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then dry the ear of humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And then if it is not pierced with all the causes which we have recounted, then you should consider that which appears before, whether it be an aposteme abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of taking that is that you at the beginning anoint the patient's vein sephamical and extract the blood according to the manner of the virtue of it, and then make a gash between your hands and turn the ear towards the divided parts, and make a small incision in the root of the ear and pour the grease of it into the place where it is pressed.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if the lunar-shaped fissure penetrates to the stone, and the stone is obstructed, then this can be treated with an appropriate instrument; and treat the fissure at that hour with speed, and cure it so that it becomes healthy.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause in the ear is one of the fatty growths that swell and become inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if it does not obey your external treatment, then take a subtle spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to him the abscession of that growth which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is moistened by the vapor of the ear, and put it in warm compresses, and extract it with fine or subtle gestures, or with a gentle incision as previously mentioned, because the extraction of it is thus alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered into the ear, it happens that the patient must use sneezing with conditioning to commence, and fill the other ear with an old cloth, and put on that ear where the water is, and if by this it is expelled, well; and if not, then take warm pebbles and onions according to the length of the finger, and heat them in the fire a little, and let the patient introduce one of these into the hole of their ear and press above one stone of that part and strike with another stone on the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not stop pouring water until all of it has been poured out.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been poured out in this way, you take a piece of paper or cloth, and put one end of it in the ear and stretch the other end to the fire until it is burnt.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And you put another cloth and make it in this way as many times as necessary until all the water has been poured out, and squeeze that one with a tube so that it is said to be an extractor of excess water from the body.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	More in the extraction of the beast that enters into that ear, if it is a small thing, take it out similarly and to its likeness, cure it as we have said in the division; but if it is of large size which causes pain in the sense of the stomach, then administer the extraction of it with gestures and anointments, and the cause of it is considered lighter than all the other causes that happen in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm engendered in the ear, when you cure it with water as we have said in the division and in the treatise of distillations and do not confound your cure, then it is necessary that you expose the ear to the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if any cause of worms appears here, then extract it with subtle gesture or with fine fingers, but if no cause appears, then take a narrow tube and insert it from below to above, which is the form of the treatment:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the thin extremity into the ear according to the quantity that the patient can tolerate; and then suck strongly on it with a firm suction, and make repeated motions, until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey your assault, then stop up and close the circuit of the tube with wax as we have said; then administer the distillations which the ancients have already proved in the cure of worms, and you will find it in the treatise of distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be that with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form.
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that one of silver or of bronze, narrow, in which there is a small hole, and with a flat surface.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore it should be as one would pack that which is in the cavity of the tube so that it will be necessary here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the thread and wrap it around the extremity of the tube decently cut, and then put oil in the cavity of the instrument, or juice of some herb, or whatever of these medicines you want in the tube — and this is in the ear —, and then insert the thread with its end into the hand and press with your hand a tempered compression until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil penetrating.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which has infiltrated in the ear should already be scraped with a small focus.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause you distillate in the ear is not too cold, because ear medicines do not tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of obstruction of the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some infants have been born with imperforated stomachs of their mothers, and this has already happened to some men, obstruction in the middle of the ear due to a plague or flesh growing in it; and this obstruction sometimes occurs in the passage of the ear's tube, which does not allow for evacuation, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the tube of it, which does not allow for evacuation, is among the major conditions of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that case where you achieve evacuation, take care to put the ear of the patient towards the sun and observe it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then if you see apparent obstruction, open it with a subtle spatula, of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it has a small width, where one part is sharp and the other not, and the spatula is two fingers wide so that it does not cause injury to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so if the obstruction is due to flesh born in the ear or in the middle of it, then you will apply subtle and violent facilitations until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the fold of the ear, then take a subtle thread and warm it with a little fire, and place it in the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have perceived an obstruction in the ear that the patient feels as a difficulty, due to gravity of hearing, force out the oppression with a facilitation; and beware that you do not harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And place a poultice on the ear made of linen according to the quantity of the size of the wound that you have wrapped in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or take cotton and put it in hot water and pulverize it over the affected area and use it; and if the ear has become apostemated, then remove the cotton and replace it with another cotton that you will wrap in wax mixed with rose oil, until the aposteme is cauterized; and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	When there is an excess of blood flow, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and apply it to the ear, and use another remedy that restricts the blood flow, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 3.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of cataracts that have developed on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Cataracts that have developed on the eyelids of the eyes, some treatments are moist, others are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, hold those in your hands or on your knee, and separate them with the spatula of their roots, and apply pressure on the places, following the prescribed method.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	When there is pain with a flow of blood, then cauterize those areas with a subtle, lancet-like cauterizer.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to apply incisions and moist dressings that promote healing when some cause of the roots remains; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of cataracts that come to the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Moist spots appear on the eyelids of the eyes for some reason, which is similar to cataract in its strength and hardness, and because of this similarity it is called cataract.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	It is an accumulation of thick humidity in the eyelid and underneath.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation on them is what you consider then if the greatness proceeds in it in that which appears of the eyelid and is bad in all parts; and the cause of it is laziness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make an incision on that part with width, and return the corrupted flesh with ease so that it evacuates, and hang that part with a bandage and cut off the dead parts.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	More so if the incision is not made on it, then do not penetrate the eyelid with a small cut little by little, then this does not harm for any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you adjust it with a suture; and cure it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer harm from that because the angent of it restores and regenerates.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the greatness declines to the inner parts of the eyelid, then remove the inner surface, then evacuate the eyelid and hang the greatness with a bandage, unless you indicate an incision, and press on the entire part, and if the eyelid by incision is lengthened, this does not harm for any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the treatment, wash the wound with salty water; and cure the area with the liquid that promotes healing from within.
Capitol .x.	And then put a bandage, wash the wound
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the treatment scratch on the eyelid of the wound.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A scratch is a grievance which is generated in the eyelids, and mainly it hurts children, aggravates the wounds of those who have cataracts, and prevents them from looking at the clarity of the sun because tears are collected in their eyes.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And for this reason they rub their eyes on their faces for a long time, and they sleep with their faces down; and also their eyelids are humid from the discharge, which has already covered the inflammation, and a sign of cataract is apparent in the wound; and when you press the area with your fingers, you feel the cataract inside.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And a certain method of operation is for the one who has the disease, to hold his head in a cloth, and then put a warm wrap on it and make a plaster, and make a circle according to the amount that contains the entire affected part, and then apply this on the area and press with the fingers all around so that the cataract is collected in the middle of the circle, and then make an opening in the middle of this humidity with a spatula through the fissure with caution, and the fissure should not be larger than the one made in phlebotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	More in the stomach cavity that you find the entire intestine wrapped up inside, so that it reaches to the diaphragm, because in most cases the intestine processes through a fissure according to the form of white grey matter.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then extract that bone with the rags you have enveloped between the strings of the divided parts and turn it around with your right and left hand until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And beware that you do not adjust in the fissure so that with the spatulum you do not reach the hole and you do not touch that thing.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	More if it does not appear to you at the beginning of the fissure, then adjust in the fissure a small one with facility until the intestine comes out; and then extract that bone as we have said; and then soak rags of flax in water and wine and vinegar and place them on the area and hold them with bandages.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And thus they are applied with salt and placed in the cavity of the fissure so that it absorbs the remainder of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it until it is healthy.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	More if there appears on the spot a hot abscess, then treat it with cold plasters until it is healthy.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter eleven.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the manners of touching the urine.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the urine there is a born plaque that adjusts to the natural pellets and becomes ancient, then those who are accustomed to the urine and make it come out in manners of maladies such as continuous tears and softening of the eyelid and web between which this is cause of destruction of the urine that is called touching of the urine, and cure itself in four manners: either with cautery on the focus; or with acute medicine according to what is said in the chapter of cauteries; or it is done by touching for incision and suture; or with canes as I will direct.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And then it is necessary that you put the head of the patient on your thigh; then turn the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is turned, it is good; and if not, insert a needle in that part where there is faithful flesh under the eyelid, and make the needle penetrate to the faithful tissue, and this be — near the margin of the eyelid where the lashes are born — near the lashes, and pull the thread to the upper parts with the eyelid, and turn it to the edge.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then put a thread in the partition of the eye, adjusting the skin with a spatula incident to the larger tear duct entering into the smaller tear duct; and then extract the filament and place it on the eyelid, covered with a small piece of cotton or cloth, and then sew above the eyelid with a needle, and let it be like the figure of an iron instrument.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	More importantly, consider that the figure should be according to the quantity of elevation of the eyelid, because this is diversified in men, since some of them indicate that a large quantity should be incident on the eyelid, according to the quantity for which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then put a thread on the spatula over the two lines that you have sutured, and begin from the larger tear duct into the smaller tear duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your natural skin opening is as large as the thickness of a kidney.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then put the hook in one of the two corners of the wound, and then scrape off that entire area, and then adjust the suture with the two lips to the skin or thread of fine flax, and let the blood flow out, and make adhere what is superfluous from the threads onto the eyebrows for some hidden causes, if you want to do it, and if not, do not cure.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then heal the stitching of the veins within three or four days, and then take care of that.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, leave the wound without stitching, and treat it with something that dries and constricts, because the eyelid is lifted by the separation of the wound and the aggregation of it; a better stitch is not needed. Thus said the ancients about the treatment.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	More emphasis is placed on being solicitous over the patient, and it is a good operation, and there is no fear in it.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another manipulation in treatment, which is that you make a figure on the eyelid like a fig leaf, and then lift the eyelid with three separated and gathered sections according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible, to have the sections, and it is not stitched, then take a needle in which there is thread and put it in the middle of the figure, and pass one end of the thread near the larger tear duct, and the other end of the thread near the smaller tear duct, and adjust between the threads so that they are equal, and then with those, lift your hand with equal elevation, lift all the skin over which is made thus as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound with a suture, and cure that interior part that needs healing.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	More often if an abscess forms on your incision or your fissure, apply that abscess with wax and to the similar area, with an ointment.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times it happens to the eyelid that the eyes are converted, therefore beware that you use in that case what we have said about incision; but a suture is more artificial in every case.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To prepare a pipe according to this method:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	and it is that you convert the eyelid and divide the figure which is next to what has been reported; and then by art make two pipes or two subtle rods from which the length is according to the length of the eyelid and the width of them is less than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already made incisions at the extremities of each separate parts, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add each one subtly under what is overflowing from the eyelid of the eye, and constrict the pipes of each part with a strong ligature, and leave it for some days, so that the thread by the constriction will die and be rejected and will fall out by itself when you remove the ligature.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	More quickly if it is delayed, then cut the torment with the tongs, and promptly cure the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore when it is congealed, the eyelid is lifted and the skin does not puncture.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the shape of two canulas which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and it has the quantity of the length and of the width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter twelve.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	About the lifting of puncturing skin on the wound with a needle where the skin is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the skin is unnatural, hard and rough and punctures the wounds, then the operation on it is that you take a fine needle and place it in a thin vein of goat and lion, and promptly adjust the extremities and anoint each one with a very subtle ointment.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be of the quantity of a palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you join another fine thread to it in short fashion, and anoint the extremities of that one if you want to.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's sick head in its proper place, and let it be near the window so that your work may be declared, for this is a subtle and minor operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the adjusted pelvis where it is necessary to inject, and make that penetrate into the festinating palate until you extract it from beneath the natural skin.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the skin inside out and insert that into the hip joint, and let the skins be one or two or three and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with it inside so that the skin is turned out at the hip joint in the festering wound on the natural skin of the pelvis.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	More if the hip joint is strained and the skin of the pelvis is not turned out, you will strain the hip joint at the separations of the faith that you have composed with it, inside which there is straining of the joint above the flaw.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And apply that to the vision of the wound, for then you will turn out the hip joint and the faith, and wrap each one and close the wound, and leave the closure for two days or three, until the skin adheres to its own place and grows over it with good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the skin of the pelvis is too short, then adjust a long skin of the natural skins to it, and elevate it with that, or let it be until it is lengthened in a suitable space, and then elevate it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter thirteen.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	On the treatment of the disease which affects the lower eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When it occurs in the eyelid, it is a contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted on its own, either to the right or to the left side, due to poor healing of a wound or of a cut or of a cauterization, and it is called leporina, and this contraction can be natural or accidental, and it is caused by poor healing of a wound or of cuts or of cauterizations, or by bad treatment.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Make the manipulation of the operation on it so that you sew up the consolidation and that you separate the lips of it, and put between them a piece of cloth, and tie them together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not think that you should use the treatment for it of the causes that dry out and constrict, because if you do that, it will return to being ulcerated worse than before, at no time will there be healing.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use for that cause things that soften, such as fenugrec, and anoint with the water in which they are cooked and a sixth part of it, or diaquilon ointment, which should be liquefied on top of the olis, and submerge the piece in it, and cure with it.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you perforate with a tool that is not consolidated according to the form that was established at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation that we have spoken of, is nothing but a rectification of the dislocation that does not restore the shape of the place as it was beforehand.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	On the cure of dislocation which is done on the eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This dislocation which is done on the eyelid, which is properly named dislocation; and it is of two kinds: one natural, the other accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	The accidental one is caused by a blow or by a cut or by a cautery or by other similar things.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of performing it is that you take a needle in which you make a double thread, and fix it in the flesh, and make it pass from the left lacrimal to the right lacrimal, until the thread appears at the two extremities of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then stretch the flesh to the separated parts, and sew that with the needle, and cut it with a spatulum abundantly.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And thus if the shape of the eyelid returns to what it should be, that's good; and if not, take the thread and pass it through the cleft figure, and with that turn the eyelid, and make two fissures on the edge of the eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And if the extremities of the two fissures of two angles of the incision are where they converge, and let there be made an angle between them, when they gather, a figure is formed from them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is called Greek letter: lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	Then place the flesh of that area according to the quantity that is the width of the needle, what is called the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then join the separated parts and sew them with the thread of flax; and then heal them with what we have said about softening medicines and poultices, so that it is sanated.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if it is necessary to make an incision by fissure or suture or cautery, then it is advisable that you make a flat fissure on the skin of the eyelid as has been previously stated.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate it with a poultice between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the summary of the sermon on the cure of sciatica when it is on the back or hip, that runs in the operation, according to how it is prepared in the form of sciatica, and this is in the form of diverse motives.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled artisan always prepares a device in each manner, which is possible for it to make the figure return to its natural form, or close to it, and that patient according to what is convenient for him of the operation and of the instruments in the best dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter fifteen.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	On the adherence of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to some men in such a way that the eyelid becomes solidified with the white of the eye, and is prohibited from the ease of movement and its natural functions, then it is necessary that you intervene with the extremity of the eyelid, and lift it up, or stretch it to the corner.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you cut the adherence with a subtle spatula, which should not be sharpened to the point of cutting, having obtained a small opening so that the patient is not disturbed by the operation, and remaining with the spatula so as not to touch the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And let your incision be such that it excises that adherence with ease, so that the eyelid is returned to its natural shape and all the adherence is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then put in the eye salt water with which you rinse it; or distill from juniper dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate the eyelid from the eye with a decoction of it, and apply on the eye a woolen cloth soaked in white of egg, and then for three days use consolidative remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter sixteen.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On the incision of the nail and the prominence of flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.
