Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Moistened places have adherence to the gullet or foot spine or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore it is necessary that you extract that which is apparent from those things, on which the sight falls, because you press the tongue with an instrument between the teeth, so that it may be declared to you what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And if that which does not appear is hidden in the throat, then make the patient vomit by inducing them to drink a concoction to purge their stomach, because the cause of the obstruction in the throat will be expelled through vomiting; or give the patient a piece of soap made from nap or root of laytuga or a dry biscuit; or take a piece of dried sea sponge and tie it strongly with a thread, and give it to the patient to swallow, so that when it reaches the place where the obstruction is located, it will be expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And take a cord and tie it strongly around the arm, and let it be left there for a while and then removed; or take a tube and insert it into the bladder and leave it in for a time.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if not expelled by these means that we have mentioned, then use an instrument made of lead in the following form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be thick enough to fit a small rod, and at its end have a cavity which you insert into the throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And raise the patient's chin upwards, and beware lest the bone of the throat or jaw touch, so that it does not injure the bone or spine, or that the doctor puts their hand on it.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	More than the emperor, the disease that is hidden within is revealed by the knowledge of the place of the cause and the surrounding area, and pulls the hand with the instrument on it, all according to the quantity that has been prepared beforehand so that it can be extracted.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood associated with the knee.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the knee is treated with medicine as we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and not with confectures, consider then on the knee of the patient to the sun, since you have compressed the tongue of it with an instrument that you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the blood vessel, extract it with a small tool or with subtle gestures decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the knee of the patient, and put in the cavity of the cannula an ignited iron, and do this as many times (until the blood vessel is dead and removed from the knee) and abstain the patient from water for the whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a full vessel of cold water, and put the mouth of it in that, and wash the mouth with that; and do not swallow any of this cause, but hold the water for an hour with your hand, because the blood vessel feels the water most when it is at rest.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	More often if the patient is not previously prepared with what we have recommended, then subject the patient to a mixture of cypress or absinthe through the instrument that we have recommended in the suffumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Make this, then in four days.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another manner of operation in the suffumigation of that, which you take a bowl in which are ignited coals and the bowl is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole, and the extremity of the instrument is composed in that hole; and apply it from below to the suffumigation; and put the patient's mouth on the extremity of the tube, and close their mouth so that the suffumigation is not expelled until you know that the suffumigation has reached the blood, because the blood then will discharge.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not descend, then repeat the suffumigation many times, and restrain the patient from drinking, and have them eat salty and bitter foods, and do not drink water, and it is necessary that with this treatment the suffumigation be expelled.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the blood of the throat is treated when it is visible; and it resembles a pair of pincers thus many times, except that it is in the alcove curved:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed in the groin area, and the extremity of it resembles a beak of a stork, that is called gout, in which there is an accumulation of lime, for this reason, when we press any cause, it does not release.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which there is the sum of the serum in collection of abscesses and in section of their discharge.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The abscesses are moved with special treatments, with various methods, according to the memory of them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and discharge of them through two methods, of which one is for the species of abscesses in themselves being treated; and for that which we press out of the humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is proper for the places in which accidents of the body occur, because the abscess that happens in the head is different from the abscess that happens in the buttocks; and the abscess in the fleshy place is different from the abscess in the joint; and each of them is judged by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more of the abscesses are such that it is preferable that they not be perforated but rather have maturation of the blood in them or completion of it.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	So other abscesses which are supposed to be pierced when they are ripe, and not matured according to their completion, just like abscesses that are applied to the joints, for an abscess that is near a joint, its being from it is prolonged until it reaches the purulent matter that is in the circuit of it, and for this reason the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, by which it is made cause of contraction of that member; or it is an abscess proper to a principal member, and if you delay the perforation of it until it is matured near the principal member; or it is proper to the anus, therefore perforate the unripe one; and it is not necessary to pierce the raw, undigested one, but only that which is proper to the anus, so that it does not press the rectum of it and is elongated to the parts divided from the anus, and a fistula is made, or that which is made in the term of it which is not sanated.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is necessary that you know the time of the perforation of the abscess, and also it is when it is matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is matured when there is a decrease in pain and a cessation of fever, and also a reduction in swelling and in pulse, and a sharpening of the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And where there is a cavity, you should know that the perforation creates a hole in the place of the abscess and of the pus coming from the treatment of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the perforation should be done through the length of the flesh or of the body, if the abscesses are in the parts of the hands or of the feet, and in the place of the veins, of the nerve cords, of the arteries; and, finally, in all hidden places where there is no reflection; because in those that are reflected, use perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is better to delay the perforation until digestion is confirmed according to the humor, as we have said; because if you perforate then, it prolongs the body of the pus and of foul matter, and forces out the lips of the wound which become hardened and the depth of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses should be perforated according to the width of the flesh or of the body as necessity dictates, or according to that which the affected member indicates.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And it is necessary to administer small perforations, and in large abscesses a large and wide perforation or several incisions according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other times the apostemas are in those places where it is necessary that the abscess be opened and drained, when it is made thus as a poultice and made in term that has already suppurated, thus like that which falls into drops of pus and boils.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are cut with a section having three angles; and of those it is in which is incised thus as the figure of a leaf of mint, thus like the apostemas of the anginas.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of them it is in those where a round section and a crescent-shaped section are administered, and similar to these.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	More, that one which is not capable thus as are the superficial abscesses of the lion, where you should make a superficial perforation, or plane only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And where the abscess is large and has collected much pus, that you should perforate it and not be concerned that you extract all the pus at that hour; having extracted from it a portion, and then apply a plaster to the abscess until the next day, and then extract a larger portion, and then make many evacuations according to the degree to which it is evacuated.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of frail virtue, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an old person in decline, because the animal spirit is greatly resolved with the egress of the pus, and hardly dies the patient, and you operate them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Keep this chapter with great caution, and return your attention to the perforation in which you will make an incision, considering that you will clean the wounds and see if the wound of the abscess is small, or a flat cut, then you administer remedies of oil or anti-inflammatory ointment; and if the abscess is large, and the cracks of the perforation are many, then consider that you put a dressing on each wound so that they heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the skin is separated or has formed a cavity, then consider that you fill it with a lot of soft cloth or yarn made from linen thread, as when you treat wounds or roots, its humidity; and apply this for three days; and then remove it and cure the area with what is necessary to heal the injuries.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if there is an outflow of blood during the time of your operation, then you administer cold water and vinegar in which you soak a linen cloth, and place it over the area of the profusely bleeding wounds.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then consider that you administer treatment and cure with powders which have been recommended in many places of our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	More so if it is in winter time, and the place of the abscess is a place of nervous movements, then it is good that you apply poultices made with wine and oil, and put them on those areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the areas are fleshy, then it is good that you apply poultices soaked in water and oil or in wine and oil, and all that is applied should be cooled so that it is the third day, as we have said, and then it is good that you lance the abscess and cleanse it and administer to it the cure that is convenient for it.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of abscesses in general, but according to the way of distinction I have already spoken of all abscesses in whatever manner is the way of the cure of them by chapters singularly.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter twelve.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section on abscesses that occur in the nape of the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the nape of the neck small abscesses form, and they are species of knots that contain tunics that are adherent to them; and the species of them are movable.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And some of them are cysts, and of those there are ones that contain humidity resembling slime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those which contain moisture similar to dust, and gather it; and of those which are muddy, rough.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, since you must not make the extraction of those cause irritation to the arteries.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you squeeze those with an instrument the shape of which goes near to them, which is called entromes, so that you know what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then separate it in section according to the length by superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the section from line B to line G. Then when the moisture is evacuated, then you excise that which contains the moisture, and do not leave any of that cause of all, for if many times seen it returns, if it remains from that cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then submerge the cot (knot or wound) in Egyptian gum, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill with that the wound and let it be until another day, for the corrosion of all that is made from that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply on that wound the Egyptian gum secondly and thirdly if it is indicated for it, until you are confident that no longer is any cause of that membrane; then cure the wound with gum until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if there is an abscess with fatty nodes, then you insert the needle in this manner:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	I have made an incision in the shape of a cross, and placed forceps between the two lips of the incision and scraped out the entire affected area, and exerted my virtue in extracting the tunic which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	More often if your bowels make counter-pressure, then do what you have previously recounted as primary.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the abscess of incision and cure according to what you have said; and an incision over a fatty abscess is considered lighter, because it is of little blood and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And some times there are abscesses in the head of some men in whom there is absolutely no humidity; the cause of which is that I have incised over an abscess on the head of an old woman and found the abscess to be hard, rough, white, and dull, which could not be drained, and if I had struck it with a pustule, it would have burst.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other accidental abscesses on the head this is not the chapter, such as the abscesses that come to the heads of infants and from the roots of the ears, but the incision of all these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	Stop the flow of those things from the lowest part of their body so that the body of the blood is alleviated to the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And properly treat those with what is convenient for that cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times we have seen these apostems appear in the neck and in the armpits and in the groin area; and some times they occur in the other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and many are engendered between them, and all of these scrofulas have their own proper tunic, and just as with the nodes and apostems of the head, just as we have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofulas are many, for some of them are gouty, and some contain humidity, and some are malignant which do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Then in that one which you find with good disposition in the Touching, of which the color of that which is manifest is proper to the color of the codena, and it is moved to all part, and it is not attached to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and it is not deep, so that you make an incision with a superficial scalpel from the upper part to the lower part of the body of the line G to the line B, and cut that entire part, and stretch two lips of the codena to one ounce, or to many ounces if you have need of them, just as we have said in the apostems of the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It is of greater caution that the vein or nerve is not injured.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be pointed, so it does not injure your hand with incision, or disturb the patient, and only incise what is necessary to incise; for if you were to incise a vein or artery and prohibited from your operation, then apply on the wound some powdered vitriol or other powders which stop flux of blood, and tighten the wound, and let that which has been rested relieve the acidity of the aposteme and be softened the wound and begin to be purged.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is separated.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation which you have begun.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then investigate with your finger if there is a rupture of any of the other small scrofula, therefore incise those and clean those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is in the root of the scrofula a large vein, beware that you do not incise that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Be careful that you tie it with a strong and doubled thread, and that you leave it so that it falls by itself without hindrance.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old oil which you have already mixed with Egyptian ointment, and then cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut out the entire scrophula, then it is necessary that you adjust the edges of the wound and cauterize as much pus as possible so that no excess remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that excess has remained due to the size of the scrofula, it is necessary that you understand how to cut out the root of that, and extract it, and apply a suture, which is what is called.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those scrofulas that contain humidity, make a superficial perforation where it appears to you the place of maturation, and stop the perforation of that which is the lowest pus of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then apply a perforation, heat up a plaster and apply it to those areas, so that it cuts away the rotten part of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound is already cleaned, then treat it with a plaster of generated flesh so that it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the section of the pill of the aposteme, accidentally taken by the apothecary.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients said that this section was in the pill, and it was not seen by any man in our land that this had been done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	More often in men there is a tendency to avoid the extraction of the stone, since it is not done gently, for which all the veins and main [blood vessels] of the patient are affected.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses or cuts in the mouth or throat or two ears, when the illness is not in the cane, it is advisable to use the section of the stone to flee the loss which is made by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore it is advisable when we want to make an incision, that we cut the stone with three circles of the stone's circles, or four with a small section for the width in the one that is between two circles by quantity, so that the incision is in the cartilage-free area, not in the cartilage, and this place is convenient for incision, because it is deprived of flesh and the veins of blood from it are few.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is inexperienced, it is advisable that he extends the ligature of the throat with an onion, and then ties the ligature so that it comes to the canal, but avoids the blood vessels if any of them are visible for some reason.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then incise the kidney as we have recommended; and it is indicated on the section of the canal by the weakness which is of that exit with what is of its disruption and by the abscessation of the mouth.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	Elevate the wound that has been opened for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Then when the hour is reached in which the perforation is feared, apply two lips of the gauze to the edge of the wound, and sew only that with the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that make the flesh grow so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the sermon which we have recommended is not an exposition but rather to show that some of these apostems have already oppressed the throat of the patient, and the patient has come near death, and his life is in between, and some are about to obstruct the epiglottis so that the patient breathes on the place of the wound by some respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And therefore I command to leave the open wound until the evil of the disease is consumed; and its evil lasts for three days; and then I command to dress the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And this that I have seen with my own eyes, is that a servant took a knife and put it in the throat and cut out a part of the vein of the lung, and I was called to its cure, and I touched the mucus as it is customary for the dead, and I uncovered the wound and I found the blood which had come out of the small wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, it was confessed that a vein or ligament had not been injured, and the wound was from the plague, and they cured it before the focus became infected.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And do not hasten to serve if it does not arrive at the desired time, and then return after some days to the improvement of their conditions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the removal of the splinter there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision regarding the aposthema which occurs in the throat before, and it is called throat hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This apostema called throat hernia is a large aposthema according to the body's coloring, and it is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is said in two ways, whether it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one is not worthy of a cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is said in two ways, of which one is similar to fat knots, and the other way is similar to an aposthema which is made by knotting of an artery, and in that one there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it does not happen that a presumption is made to him with an iron except in the case where it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe that and investigate it with the said, and if you find something similar to fat knots, and it is not suspended on any of the veins, then you cut it in the same way as the knots, and extract it from what contains the pus and abscess; and if not, then all the blood is pressed out, and then treat the place with what is suitable for a cure until it becomes healthy.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter twelve.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section of the species of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the knots, many species and I have already said all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And I recommend that you recount thus the difference between a knot and an abscess with certain doubtlessness.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that with an abscess there is heat and fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the surplus is sedated; and it is a completed putrefaction which then ceases the fever, the pain and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with a knot there is no heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains that pus which is in its own sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a cyst and is made thus as a vacuity, whether major or minor, and they are according to two species, which are either fat or contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, as I have said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore I say, when you come to the cure of a knot, that you expel that and inquire into its beginning with an instrument which is called an intrument, as will be seen in the chapter which is next.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the method of inquiry into abscesses and all knots, and it is that you take this instrument and insert it into the humid place which you find in the abscess, and you will turn the threads of the needle little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the kernel.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then put your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the abscess, and extract the entrails and consider what is coming out from the remains of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing humidity is forgotten, of whatever color it may be, then you dry it with a superficial drying according to what has been said about other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the remains of the entrails there is no humidity, then you should know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry on it with drying having the shape of a cross according to this shape:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	thus as you have been taught, and suspend that which is excessive, and scratch the crust from all parts with ease, and keep the skin or sack, if you can, over that and extract that blood from the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken during the operation, it is not possible to extract that blood, and many times it happens that this occurs, and then you extract it by pieces until none of it remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if some of it remains for any reason, a little or too much, the knot returns according to the worse.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that some small part of it remains, then complete the wound with some sharp corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and apply a cauterized dressing on the area where the abscess was, and cure that with another treatment until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large knot, then kiss the patient's lips and cure that which grows in the flesh.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If the pulse is rapid in the patient, or slow, then touch and fill the place of the third finger with a poultice made from vitriol and apply it for two or three days until the plague disappears and the swelling of the blood subsides; and then return to cut away that which is rotten from the knot.

And it is from three species, of which some are long, and others are medium, and others are short, according to the quantity of the size of the fistula and the tightness of it.

Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which the section is made are sharp and the other extremities are not sharp, and not placed in such a manner, but rather so that it can be done gently in the scraping of the nodes, the fear of incision of a vein or of a nerve, and for this reason the patient is comforted and regains tranquility for a little while, which they obtain from the excoriacion of the abscess.

And it is seen that these species of tumors are yours, large, medium and small, because through them the flow of blood is diverted with speed when necessary, and then when at first it is not medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz. E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And certain surgical procedures are made with those small instruments, others resembling scissors or forceps, according to this form; through which the blood is separated when it is done by venesection, or by incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And certain surgical procedures are made roundly according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of men's breasts which are similar to women's.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Certain men have swollen breasts which are caused by excessive sleep and poor diet, and as a result their breasts become swollen and similar to women's, and it is considered shameful.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to the one who has this condition, it is necessary to make an incision on the breast in the lunar section according to this form, from line B to line G, and then remove all the excess flesh, and fill the wound with incarnate medicine, and sew the two lips of the wound together with stitches, and heal the one inside until they are cured.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast declines to the sides and is softened by its size, similar to that of women, then it should be divided into two parts, with two sections resembling a lunar figure, each one contained in the other up to the end of each, so that the larger section contains the smaller one according to this form, from line B to line G. And then remove the flesh that is between the two lips of the wound, and remove the excess fat, and administer what we have said about the stitches and powders, whatever is necessary for the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what must be cut due to the anxiety of the patient, and because of an outflow of blood, then it is necessary to fill the wound with a submersed plaster in a corrosive ointment and lay on that which corrodes the rot of the fracture, and properly cure that which is affected by the disease.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the perforation of abscesses that come out at the nipple.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that come out at the nipple are of the species of scrofula, and tumors, which contain a skin that is sacred.

E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then let the wound be dressed and treated with a suitable ointment for that, so that it may be healed.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the section of abscesses that occur by acridity or by vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When the artery is broken, and the vein is consolidated which is above it, then putrid abscesses are suspected, and the signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscesses are from the artery or from the vein: for when an abscess is from the artery it is long and accumulated in the thorax of the body; and when you press the abscess with your fingers, you feel a stridor in the vein.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is from the vein is round at the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And a section about this abscess is an error, especially in that which is near the shoulders, and in the armpits, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very bad, therefore it is necessary that its treatment be avoided with iron, and that which is in the extremities, or at the head, it is necessary that it be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	More about that which is from the flow due to inflammation of the arterial orifice, incision in the vein section in the long; and then make an incision with knives and then reveal the artery, and removal of the tunics until it be discovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put the needle on that thread and make it penetrate between the other sides, and tighten the ligature with double fidelity in two places, — which causes you to extract the excess humors from the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then touch the place which is between two ligaments with spatula so that the blood comes out from it, and let the abscess be dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer the cure in which pus is generated until the ligaments fall; and treat that with a suitable ointment for that, so that it will be healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to a cut vein, then take care that you hold with your hand the thing that is nearest to the abscess on the side of the body, and put the needle in the place where you have held your hand, and make it penetrate; and let it be in the double thread by which you extract from one side, and tie the abscess with a good ligature as I have told you in the ligature of the uva, on two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then put the thread in the needle before all the abscess goes out of the first incision, and tighten the threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in the middle place of the entry that when it comes out what is in it, afterwards you cut the excess of the quiver, and let out what is bound to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And apply a poultice on it that has been submerged in wine and oil, and administer the cure that is made with warm compresses and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter one of the abscess which occurs due to twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Thus as the abscess occurs in the artery and in the vein, similarly the abscess occurs in the nerves when it occurs due to their percussion or when it occurs from excessive effort, and from similarities.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made worse by it in the places of the joints or of the ankle, or in any place where the articulations are flexed.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe abscess, and it resembles the color of the rest of the body, and it is in the worst of its conditions six of them and when it is constrained with inflammation, it seems to the patient similar to stupidity.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that gathers in the front of the body, and for this reason the quiver is applied, and it is increased on one side and does not go to the sides either from the front or from the back.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, it is not suitable for those who have joint pain to be treated with iron, because the treatment would cause a strong contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	Pain in the head or forehead is treated with a plaster.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If it is a mild abscess, then apply warmth and separate that which is putrid from the root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with a hook, and excavate that, and apply an ointment to that; and adjust the wound with a suture, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the section of abscesses that occur in the spleen which occur near the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	We find in some men fatty growths in the bellies of those and in other parts of the body of those that have spleens which are called fungal due to similarity with fungi, of which the root is subtle and the head is thick; and already the lips of those are turned, and it is of those that are small, and it is of those that are very magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in the belly of it there were two spleens which were more similar to fungal growths, and there was no difference between those whites, of minimal root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were turned inward and were split, and moisture flowed from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Then I inserted a probe into them and inserted one in the foot with eighteen threads, and another with six threads.
