Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another incision tool; this one resembling a rasp, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the erosion of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of rasp that suits the erosion of that which is perforated by the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and of sharp extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made from iron of India, and similarly it covers all the causes that we have spoken of regarding gnawing and cutting and sawing.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision of extremities and of the sawing of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities are putrefied either by an intrinsic cause or an extrinsic cause, or when you apply medicine to that corruption for the cure of those medicines and the cure does not help, or sometimes the corruption goes up to the member which is not perceived by any cause, then it is necessary that you cut that member within that bone where the corruption has reached, so that the disease escapes through that of death or gangrene which is a greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the signal of that which happens, is that the member becomes black within until it seems that fire has already consumed it, or it is covered with blackness within until the putrefaction reaches into that member which is next to it and which takes everything in the body; and thus you will know that you should cut that member.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if the cause of the corruption is a puncture by some venomous causes, such as that of the sea scorpion or of the viper or of the rue or of similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or percussion is in the extremity of the said, then you insert the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it does not enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it happens to the hand, then you insert that from the root of the forearm, and do not give space to the corruption until it takes hold in the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it swells, then insert the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond and the swelling reaches the elbow, then in that case it is death for the patient; and to administer another cause or treatment in that circumstance is a matter of quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do to the foot when corruption swells the toe of the foot, then you insert it up to one of the ankles.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the sole of the foot, then you insert the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	More so if it reaches inside the tooth, then you insert the leg up to the joint of the tooth.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread over the tooth, then in him it is not a cure but rather dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the technique of cutting or severing it is that you stretch the ligament in the partition where you want to cut, and stretch another ligament on the spot; and extend the minister one ligament to the partitions where you want to cut, and extend the minister another ligament on top; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments so that the spatula can enter and all the flesh be exposed; and then it is cut or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And cover that a cloth of linen is placed on all the partitions so that it does not touch the spot itself, and let the adjusted poultice with cauterized paste come to the lesion.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is an excessive flow of blood when you operate, then you cauterize the spot gently, or apply to it some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your treatment until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then tie the wounded limb with a bandage in a convenient way, and cure it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which happens to a man in his sixth foot, this doctor's accident which I and you have recommended, which is why the blackness occurs in the sixth foot with adjustment that was assembled from combustion of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption occurs primarily in the sieve-like intestine that holds the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself for the cure by going to the member with the violence of the one that provokes pain and adjustment of it, and it happens that the foot goes into the joint, and thus heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time does it take for this corrupt condition to occur in the said part of the hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then comes to me, and I have thoroughly examined the excess that I placed on the hand of the medicines, near the purification of the body of it; and it is not excessive and begins to go to the other part inside which begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And it happened that I had to operate on the hand of it, and I did not want to do this operation above the excessive reaction, and more than I feared the incision of the death of the hand, because the virtue of the patient was in a state of decay.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he was cured by me, he returned to his land and it came to me that that man prepared and operated on his whole hand, and is healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And this narrative has not been joined except to be helpful regarding what is extracted from this disease, and that it be significance for which it is signified and according to which it is worked.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of sins and the quality of purging with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When abscesses occur in certain fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it forms a collection of blood, and then it is broken and perforated, and the blood comes out, and the place is washed with hot water as if it were a vessel, and the dressing that is applied on top of it is like a subtle cloth, and it does not lead to further corruption, and it does not impress upon the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and not a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged until the corruption affects some member, then it is called a fistula and not an abscess.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that a dressing is applied, like one that is turned and wrapped around, especially when it is made subtle and done with cloth, and bandages that do not stick to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the dressing will adhere and that the corruption will not have advanced by further consequence, then your cure is to apply a purging cluster.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the arm that you put in has a foul smell, then administer a cluster with an Egyptian medicine which is made of oil and bitter vinegar and ginger, receiving equal portions, and adjust them in a vessel, and cook them over the fire until the medicine becomes soft and penetrates to the depth of the honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take the water that is necessary and mix it with water and honey; and introduce an enema into their anus, and cleanse their orifice, and administer the medicine to them for a duration of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that with a spoon; and do this for as many days until the anus is purified and the bad smell is eliminated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is administered with water of ash, when this medication is not present; and that is to take the ashes of vines, and put them in water; and then mix that and administer it as an enema until you are convinced that the anus is relieved.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance for the Egyptian medication or the water of ash, then administer an enema with water and honey mixed with ground ginger, and also administer it with wine and honey, because the property of honey is that it purifies and cleans, and the wine makes the anus adhere, especially when the wine has been treated to remove its excess acidity and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this sometimes and are convinced that the anus is already cleaned, then administer an enema with water that makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	It is that you take an ointment of dissolution and dissolve it with olive oil and vinegar; or that you administer a suppository with certain medications and other ointments that have the properties which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the anus is narrow and the canal of the suppository is not received, then you widen it with a small iron instrument little by little, and place in the warm water wrapped in Egyptian ointment or in basilicon ointment until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is large, then you bring together the lips of the wound with a suture and adjust the quantity in which the suppository is introduced.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of that from which the arm is elevated to the separated parts above, then dry that in the pus at the lowest place where it is near the passage through which the arm runs, for when the arm is constricted in the depth of the sinus, the flesh will be engendered there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus through the passage of the pus below as you wish, then you should perforate so that you prepare the member with preparation for which the arm runs freely according to how it is apparelled and that no cause of retention of the arm remains.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take medicines that consolidate and are applied on the convenient wound to what you want to extend those onto a piece of cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And let the cloth be of such great quantity as it covers the entire wound; and then insert in the holes of the cloth on the right of the orifice of the wound a tube put there, ample enough so that the orifice of the wound is not blocked; and then spread on another cloth of linen the plaster according to the quantity of the hole, and place it over that for a long position of the orifice of the wound so that the swelling of the arm is alleviated and do not press the cloth except to lift it up a little at a time.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	More, that which is on the orifice of the wound, which you change every hour so that it becomes adjusted to the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know if what comes out of the arm is a lot or a little, or is digested, or not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And then you consider the place of that wound, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medication is prolonged in such a manner, and you see the material that is thrown on the orifice of the wound already adhered, or takes adherence, then you can dressing it on the third day, and when you dress the wound, then change the cloth for another and renew the plaster.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	More often if the sinus is approached with a subtle and gentle touch, do not despair of its adhesion, because the healing of it is appropriate, since in some cases delayed generation of flesh in the wounded areas occurs, and in those same cases the opposite of that is done.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the sinus is touched by moving days and bad indigestion, then you know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and is a prolonged cause, then you adjust with desiccation of the medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried thus as an ointment of diafinicon, when there is adjusted superflluity of addition of zeal.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the best remedy by which it is cured, is that you take an ointment of diafinicon and dissolve it in rose oil, and apply it on the wound with antique gum in its substance, and confirm this on him, and use it for him.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems similar in that action, when there is no bad indigestion, ointment of diafinicon, as much as it is cooked until it is thickened, and use it; or take myrrh and aloe and ashes, and triturate all and pulverize over the honey when it is on the fire, and apply this on a cloth and tie it around the sinus; and apply that with the honey which you have cooked until it is thickened, and pulverize on a cloth and tie it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes the aristolochia plant's long root and celestial lily (which is the celestial lily) and powder of centaury, and use of those simple or adjusted things, triturate them and pulverize over the honey which has been recommended; and use its juice.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sore is prolonged, and it's not healed by this treatment, then you should know that the corruption is in the patient's abdomen, and has already made its way into the bones or other hard members or ligaments; then you will cure it with a fistular treatment, as has been said before.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of wounded soles and rubbed-away nails and the cutting of added fingers and division.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A panarici is an apostema which arises from the nail of the thumb or big toe of the hand or foot, and it appears in other fingers, and when it's prolonged its treatment is less prized, or it's cauterized with a hot iron, or it's corrupted, and it throws out a greenish matter that corrodes the root of the nail, and it corrupts entirely, and it perforates its corruption to the bone within which is to it a foul odor, and it makes the extremity of the said member, and its color becomes dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And then when you have that tool which we mentioned in the division and do not confuse your treatment, it is good that you remove all the excess that remains from the nail and cauterize the wound properly with that tool, for cauterization is beneficial in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail have already begun to compress the flesh at the edges, and they start to prick and cause pain, then it is good that you apply a subtle paste under the angle of the nail that pricks the flesh, and push it upwards and cut that flesh with ease, and apply on top of that which remains from the corrosive medicines until it be completely removed; and properly treat that area with ointment until it be healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput. And if the decay and corruption reach to the finger, then you cut it out in one of the joints according to where the sensation is most affected, and properly treat that area until it be healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail receives a blow or injury, and it causes violent pain, then it is good that you start by applying flebotomy to the patient, and properly cut the nail with a sharp spatula, cutting transversely downwards, and beware that the cut does not penetrate into the flesh that is beneath the nail, for you will cause the patient violent pain, and it will be a cause of excessive scar tissue formation in the area; and properly treat that area with what calms the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	More said adjusted, which is born in the hands of some men, strong and muscular all over, and strong it is in their bones, or strong it is in their nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born in the root of the joint, or it is the birthplace of them in some nodes of the said.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	More that which is born in some nodes of the said does not move badly, and this which is born in the joints is strongly moved.

More in that which is born in the said nodes, it happens that you should insert at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then sew with one of those suitable needles for this, and then heal what is inside so that it is healthy.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	From the incision of veins, there come varices.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are varices, and they are thick, swollen veins full of melancholic superfluities that come in motion to the limbs of the body, and the greatest occurrence of them is in the thighs, especially in the thighs of travelers and laborers and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore it is necessary that you administer purification of the body from black bile with some evacuations to forceful expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The cure of them with iron is according to two methods: one is that the incision is made and the black blood is attracted out, and the other method is that the vein is elevated and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The treatment of it is according to this method: wrap the beginning of the thigh with hot water until the thick blood is dissolved, which is filthy, and then tie the patient's thigh tightly at the upper part of the hip inside to the back of the knee with a bandage, and then make an incision in one place, or two, or three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with the hand from the back of the thigh within its confines, and from within outwards, until the amount of blood that you want is discharged and which satisfies the strength of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then attach that, and command them to abstain from foods that engender black bile.

More elevation is achieved in this manner: you raise the patient's leg, if it is moved by them, and then put it in a bath and immerse the leg in hot water until it becomes red and the veins are filled; or it can be exercised through vigorous exercise, if a bath is not available, until the member is warmed up.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then make an incision on the right of the vein for drainage in the loin or in the back of the knee, or at the lowest part of the knee, near the ankle.

And if the vita is constricted having twisted the area where there is an enclosure of the partitions, and it's not according to rectitude as we have said, then it's necessary that you make a ligature on that entire partition of twisting and on the areas of enclosure, and return the suture upwards with a bend so that you elevate that entire area.

Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Figure of the incision on which the vita is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of a bent claw:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not suited to him to be pointed like the claws nor of sharp extremity so that it does not harm the vein; and it is of coarse flexibility, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein due to its subtlety; but there is in it a superfluous coarseness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the curved vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in cold and damp lands, just as in the land of Arabia and in the dry and arid lands of little tenderness, and in which there are neither herb nor tree.

And the gestation of it is from putrefaction that comes from the gut, as when venomous things penetrate the body, such as snakes and worms and lice, generating between the gut and the flesh.

E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the movement is prolonged, then cut a part of it and wrap the remainder; do not cut that which is rooted until it is completely removed, because if you cut it, it becomes contracted and enters into the flesh and causes to appear an aposteme and pus in the place and bad ulceration.

And if it happens at the time of its medication, then introduce the needle into the hole of the patient and puncture that long hole in the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction of the place for some days with medicines; and then treat that one with the treatment of abscesses.

De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section concerning worms generated under the skin, and it is called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is named in some lands near us as bovine disease because many times worms are found in the intestines and it's a worm that is born between the skin and the flesh, and goes throughout the body pushing and swelling, and shows itself to our feeling from member to member until it breaks the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	The generation of it is from the putrefaction of certain humors, just like when worms and serpents and intestinal parasites occur in the stomach.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its malice, because when it goes into the body and is elevated to the head, and it reaches the brain, then it strongly grips the man and enters and destroys the brain, and that causes many visible evils.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure that and extract it, then do not proceed unless you have examined the sensation and appearance of it, and then consider what is above it and what is below it with binding and strong constriction, and apply heat above it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit. If it has reached the head near the brain, then apply a strong strictura on the eyebrow, and apply heat above it, and extract it; and consider that the patient use purging of their body with medicines that evacuate bad putrid humors, and guard against foods that generate putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the cutting regarding the nausea.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called nausea in our land, and it is a pain that comes in various members, and then spreads from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And already I have seen that thing which I will recommend to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and after it had been rubbed for an hour, I saw that inflammation increase thus as if it were a worm growing, and more quickly than it would be if it were silver, thus as if you could see it run from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then I put the needle in the pain of that place and fixed it into the muscle, and then I left it there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then I ran to the other side of the body until I reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I recommended to me that it circulated throughout the body according to what I had seen; and it was very marvelous of the transmutation of it and of the speed from member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this before in my wells in the same manner, however I have seen many cases where pain is transferred from limb to limb.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	More pain is seen in the heels as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And it is not thought to be that, but rather it is because of that for which the woman was old, with dry body and uncovered veins, and in this appearance shows the distorted ventilation changed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it not appear according to this curvature in those who are delicate and have a humid body with covered veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want the cure of it, and the patient feels that pain, then do not appear at the heel as we have said, but stretch over that and place a ligature and dryness on that until the distorted ventilation is constricted, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	More often if you treat the heels, then cure that with excretion of the body and with that which expels windy humors, and purify those with foul-smelling pills and with pills of serpent and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of extraction of arrowheads.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrowheads are diversified according to the species, and according to the locations of the body in which they lodge, for their diversity is that some of them have large points, and small ones, and concave, and blunt, so are solid; and of them some have three angles, and of those to which some have barbs; and of those to which some are tinned.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the passions in which the accident occurs is according to two manners: for the principal members or the main organs, such as the brain, the heart, and the liver, and the lungs, and the intestines, and the bladder, and its similar ones; and therefore when you cut into one of these members and you find signs of death, which cause you to recount nearby, then beware that you avoid extraction of that arrow from those in whom death is seated in the major dispositions, and when you do not appear to have these bad signs, and the arrow is not lodged in the depth of the member, then you extract it and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of the wound it is when the arrow cuts into it, and penetrates the bone, and there comes out from the siphac, which is above the brain, because it happens through vehement sweating, and sciatica, and vertigo, and pain in the limbs, and inflammation and pain of the tongue, and spasm and confusion of understanding and vomiting of bile, and the speech is greatly hindered and the voice is destroyed, and there comes out from the place of the wound a white humidity resembling pus, and it seems to be attached to the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And thus if this symptom appears to you, then abstain from the treatment and from the extraction of the arrow, if it is not outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	More symptoms of the arrow when it is in the heart, so that it is near the left breast, and it seems that it has been fixed by a hard cause, and not a hollow one; and for this reason the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the pulse, and the running of the black blood, and dry coldness, and sweating, and syncope; and thus you will know that death descends in two days.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the symptoms when the arrow has wounded the lung are expectoration of foamy blood from the wound, and the vessels that are near the neck are swollen, and the color of the patient is changed, and they exhale a great amount of foul breath, and demand cold fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow is in the membrane which is in the chest, and the pain then is near the little ribs, and it is made with great and vehement pain and with sighing, and not all the limbs of the muscles are moved.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow is in the stomach, then for this reason the eyes of the wound become bloody and somewhat indigestible matter comes out.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	If the arrow is lodged in the belly, and it's fixed in him, there will be some wound or tear in the flesh, or intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope for a cure except by extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	If the arrow is lodged in the bladder, and urine comes out of it, and some cause proceeds from it to the privy parts, and forthwith there is severe pain on the patient, then you should know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	More, the other members like the face, the neck, and the shoulder, and the shoulders and the arms, and the vertebrae of the back, and the armpit and the thigh, and their similar members, are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not touch vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recommend to you that which I have seen regarding the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand for yourself about their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	This is the cause, for when an arrow struck one man in the tear duct of his eye at the root of the nose, and I extracted it from him through the other side, leaving the grey matter of the brain untouched, and he was healed, and no harm came to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	To extract another arrow from a Jew, which had fallen into his body in the thigh area, the eyelid was lifted and the arrow was already hidden and not found except for a small extremity to which it adhered to the flesh, and it was a large arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, made of iron on which there were no feathers.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew was happy, and it did not harm his thigh badly, the accident.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And he extracted another arrow from a Christian man, which had fallen into his shoulder, and it was an Arabic arrow, and this one had feathers; and then he cut around that between two guides, and it was already submerged in the shoulder of the man; and then he was very skilled with that, and carefully extracted it, and the Christian was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And he extracted another arrow from a man which had fallen into his lower abdomen, and they thought that he would die from it; but since after thirty days there was no change in him regarding any of the symptoms, he cut around the arrow and engineered around it, and he was healed, and the accident did not harm him badly.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow had fallen into his back, and the wound was consolidated on him, and since he was about seven years old, the arrow reached the root of the hip.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	I see a woman to whom an arrow was shot in her lower abdomen, and the wound is consolidated within her, and she does not change her natural dispositions in anything, and the woman does not suffer harm in some of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I see another man to whom an arrow was shot in his face and the wound is consolidated, and the arrowhead remains, not causing much pain, and showing few symptoms of this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the man of the king's princes which was shot in the middle part of his nose and had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrowhead was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to his treatment after the shooting of the arrow within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I found the wound of the arrow very tight; and then I searched for that with a subtle thread, and did not feel it; but when I touched his right ear, he felt pain, and then I suspected that this prick was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied a plaster to the place with an emplaster that has attractive and digestive virtues, trusting that the place would reveal to me where the arrowhead was, so that I could cut above it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And it does not happen in the location of the significant accident that the arrow has reached that place; and you continue with the plaster on it for many days and it does not happen accidentally; and the wound is consolidated meanwhile, and the patient suffers from the extension of it for a space of many days until one day I feel the arrow inside my nose and recognize that I have it.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I apply medicine, acute corrosive, on the wound for many days until it is opened, and with the tent I have probed that, and extracted the end of the subtle arrow, which adheres to the wood.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjust in the opening of the wound with that acute medicine until it appears visibly to me the end of the arrow, and passes to my hands with it for the space of time until four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then since the wound is enlarged, and it is possible for me to insert the forceps into it, and I manipulate that, and do not obey excessively, then I do not cease to subtle and ingenious with various ingenious devices, until one day I hang them from the ceiling with a device of ingenious contraptions, according to the shape of those in the end of the chapter, until I extract it; and then I restore the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose is not restored, and yet it is restored, and the wound is consolidated, and health is given to the patient through complete healing, and nothing remains in them for any cause.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extracting some sayings for which pauses this rule and significance about what has not been said, because the parts of this art and the definitions of that are not comprehended with narration nor do they comprehend it freely.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artisan compares little to few; and what is present to what is absent; and finds new operation and new instrument for the descent of the strange causes of the art when accidents occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not extracted from the members in which they are fixed except in two ways: either by attraction of the place in which it enters; or by the opposite of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is thrown by the place where it enters, or is an arrow proceeding to a fleshy place, and is attracted and extracted.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey the evacuation of the hour in which it is retained, then it is good that you leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it becomes putrid, and the attraction of it and its egress are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if the condition is fixed in the bones and does not obey your treatment, then leave that for some days and repeat that with traction and massage each day, and already it has been driven out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your treatment for some days, then it is necessary that you perforate in the circuit of the arrow on that bone of the entire affected part with a subtle taravel so that the area of the arrow is amplified, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is fixed in the bone of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears to the patient some of those accidents which are said and told, then abstain from the extraction of the arrow and leave it until the blood is being evacuated for some days; because if the arrow perforates the diaphragm, then death is not prolonged for him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not fixed but only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the diaphragm, and the patient remains for some days, and none of those accidents happen to him, then put your effort in the traction of the arrow and in the traction of him.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	More so if it is deeply fixed and does not obey your extraction, then you administer taravels in the circuit of the arrow as we have recommended, and carefully cure the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is already lodged in the part of the body, and it is lodged in the sentiment, then you inquire about that sensation, and if you feel that, then draw out that arrow with instruments suitable for the attraction of it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot operate on it due to the contraction of the wound and the length of the arrow, and there are neither bones nor nerves nor veins here, then make an incision on the wound until it is enlarged and it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it has reached the ears on which it is held, then cut the flesh in which it is embedded with all the skill you can; and operate above that, if you cannot operate on the evacuation of the flesh in the fracture of the ears and twisting of those until it comes out.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in whatever place it is, then use your hand with twisting and force on all parts until it makes that come out; and proceed with subtle subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and is made subject to your difficult attraction of it and its extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot operate on that at your hour, then leave it for several days until the parts that are in the area of it can be cleansed, and then return to that which has been alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if you find an opposing flow of blood, then administer what we have said about treatment in the previous chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And beware of your skill in cutting veins or nerves, or cords, and administer with caution in every way possible to avoid the removal of the arrow; and do this with ease and tranquility and slowness and firmness, as you have been advised.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore make the arrow contract so that the patient is in a position according to the figure according to which you must remove the arrow from them, for it is more advantageous.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But the arrows that are thrust out by the opposite part of the body, or that already proceed from one part to the outer parts, or that make swelling of the extremity of the arrow due to sensation of the part plus close to the adjacent region and many times that same painful spot; then you will cut above that; and let the incision be according to the quantity in which the forces take hold; and then pull out that, for it is made easier by sensation.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then twist the iron according to the opposite direction that the arrow presses into the bone, and insert the tongs, and then extract that.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for several days, and then insert a tube into where it will be.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the wooden part of the arrow is in it, then remove it with water.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	More if the wooden part has fallen and you want to administer an injection, then introduce it, if it is narrow, push with a blunt instrument so that it enters the cavity of the arrow shaft and remove it with water.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is hollow, then push it out with a strong instrument entering into it, because the arrow is relieved by it.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then take out all the flesh in which it is, if it is possible for you, and then treat it with water that is suitable.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the chest, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the ribcage, and it is near so that you can touch it with your fingers, and it is possible for you to feel it, then feel it carefully and beware of cutting a vein or nerve, and extract it, and then dress the wound if it is necessary, and treat it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Shape of the forces where the arrows are thrust:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their extremities are like a bird's beak which are made with a saw when they grasp the arrow so that they do not let it go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And from those are made many special remedies, large, small, and moderate, according to the quantity of the greatness of the arrow and of its poverty, and of the width of the wound, and of the constitution of the patient.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Shape of an implant concave to this hollow extremity, made like a bird's feather so that it alleviates the entry of the arrow in it, and push of the dull part:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Shape of an implant for a dull extremity:

De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebotomy of the veins.

E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck from the place with a cup, it is more desirable in treatment.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with sour wine and then with hot water; and let it be rubbed and squeezed out.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body of the blood is prolonged due to the removal of the bloodletting, and it is that which flows back, then you put on a cloth dipped in cold water, and place that over it until the flow is stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	If the blood is multiplied, then powder the vitriol trissat, or galls and similar things according to the stiptic causes, until the blood is dried; or place the plaster of roasted and ground favas on the area, and let them stay until the favas adhere to the spot, and thus the blood is dried.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And remove, if necessary, the repetition of bloody fluxes, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the bloody fluxes are prohibited from suspension, then rub the area with recent blood or stick a needle in the spots until blood comes out; and then let them be placed, for they will sense some blood as soon as it is absorbed.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall, powder a little ground aloe, or salt, or ash, over those, and apply as needed.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the project of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is of many seen necessities in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fracture and of accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Or, son, know that they mock this chapter, foolish doctors and the vulgar, and those who for a long time did not regard the books of the Ancients nor read from them a single letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	Because of this cause, it is made that this manner of the scientists in our land is private; and you do not forget it at any time, nor do you abandon what you learn, but rather through lengthy reading of the books of the Ancients and study on the understanding of those, until you extract the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then direct experimentation and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which my experience has passed; for I have abbreviated it for you and others, and freed it from the burden of length; and I have abbreviated it at the end of the abbreviation; and I have shown it at the end of the declaration; and I have formed in it many forms of the remedies that are administered to it, as is done by addition of declaration, just as it was done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from the fractures of bones, from which a preliminary discussion is necessary, before we begin the reminiscence of fractured members and diverse things of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	It is fitting that we say in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of which, at the beginning, the artisans are forbidden and a stop is put on the truth of those; so it is you and those who are prompt to know or learn this noble art, other than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And thus I say that when there occurs a fracture or dislocation or sprain or fall, then it is advisable to begin with phlebotomy or to remove that, or whatever seems appropriate at the same time, if no cause prohibits it, such as debility of virtue, or if it happens to an infant, or to someone in decrepitude, or during a time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content with a diet of fresh herbs and meat of birds and crab; and forbid gross meats and filling up on foods and all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are secure from aposteme caut, and if you do not fear an effusion of material to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to their primary regimen, in which their custom usually runs.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And thus when the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is advisable that the patient be fed with nutritious foods of nourishment, soft and light in which there is viscosity, such as foods made from whey, and broth, and cabbage, and peas, and cow stomachs, and marrow, and fresh fish, and similar foods, and with this regimen there is made a coagulation of the fracture and a soothing and mending.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And it is known that the brittle bones, when they are in the old men who are in the first weakness and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they be continued and consolidated according to their nature by the desiccation of the limbs of theirs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature for a long time by the desiccation of those limbs, and they continue and consolidate those that are of theirs at the end of childhood, just like the bones of small infants.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But my emperor's nature adjusts and connects above the broken bone of any part a similar cause to glue in which there is grossness that adheres and strengthens that thing so that it is conglutinated and tied together, until it reaches the end of strength and firmness, just like fire at the beginning, until some cause does not prohibit it from its functions.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you apply the dressings to the patient, dressings in which there are gravity and viscosity and grossness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Motion of a fracture varies according to the diversity of the member (or limb).
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly all the other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And you should come with the remembrance of the entire species of fracture, explained in the seventh distinct chapter apart.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is a diverse multitude of fractures in this medicine.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fractures of the bone are diversified in their medicines; for there is made a curved fracture and another that occurs in the stars; and some seen are made a fracture according to the length of the bone: and so the fractures of the sagitta and of the astragali and the proceeding and non-proceeding, thus as it is done in the pain when it is prepared to write, and it is a fracture with a wound and disruption in the head, and it is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each species has its own proper engine or torment in restoration of the thing, according to what will come from remembrance of the distinct in the seven places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is recognized a fracture of the bone: it is crookedness of it, and of that prominence and apparentness to feeling, and so from it when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And then when there is not in the place a visible crookedness nor does it seem so, you should touch with gentle touch when you touch the bone with agitation and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is not fracture here.
