Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there is a twisted or small fissure, therefore it does not fit that you put your hand on it and compression of all; meanwhile pause over them with the medicine of which you have remembrance, and apply it strictly to the location for subtle tightening.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you know the location when it is curved and not divided into two or other things that do not happen in the satire, as the whole part of its comparison is re-measured, then it fits that you start from your time to rectify the aforementioned thing that happens to the place with an apostema cautery.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it happens to the place an apostema cautery, then let it be for some days until the apostema stops; and apply a poultice according to each manner that you are able to make of lightness and of art.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you know that the restoration of it and the reduction of it is better than the operation on the bone in which the accident happens.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to what will come from its remembrance.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	More so if the bone is satiated, then it is necessary to extend this broken member of two parts, whether it's the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two strings or with one string and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be where you hold the limb in its natural shape, while the extended parts of the member are trembling, then you will perforate to make the additions return to their place and according to each manner that you can put them in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself according to your strength so that you do not fall on the patient during the operation, nor cause harm; and perforate yourself according to your own power that you apply one bone to another as their best companion according to their natural forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is convenient that at that time you touch with your hand, and if sometimes here there is a different cause, rectify it and adjust it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, just as foolish doctors do, who cause abscesses or cause contraction in the member, as we have seen happen through the operation of their foolish treatments.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then connect, then equate and perform a decent operation and strictness on that member, and give rest and tranquility; warn the patient about this and make them avoid moving it during their watchfulness and sleep, and observe its revolution and agitation, and control its egestion, and control all its movements with all its virtue; and wait until the position of the member is a position in which the pain is ensured, which is why when one feels pain in the disposition of the position of the member or the injury; then it is convenient to change that to another disposition in which one does not feel pain; and guard that the position of that one is straight and equal, so that the member does not incur crookedness when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the tranquil member is that which you should recommend; because you should know that the constricted members are diversified in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm and the finger and the elbow, it seems that the covering should be of a very thin cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large, such as the thigh or the leg, it seems that in them there should be a hard and tight bandage, because the tight binding connects the large member and strengthens it entirely with strict constriction, so that in it no abscess enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, then make your evacuation of balance, apply a suitable poultice to that, on the place of that fracture with three bandages or four according to what the member deserves; and strengthen your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to the most superior part of the place of the fracture, and strengthen it so that you do not loosen the constriction which you have applied to the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen to yourself the bandage of the place of the fracture a little, and loosen the constriction bit by bit, until you take from the place a large part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and envelop the other wounded area around the location with a bandage, and apply it to the affected areas of the fracture; and be your operation in the tightening of the bandage and in softening of that one as we have said in the primary bandage above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then insert a pad of cotton or cloth between the bandages if there is a curvature of the fracture, so that the irregularity of the fracture is absorbed; and if not, do not put anything on it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then put a pad on the other bandage, and absorb onto these decently made bandages as much as there is no inflammation or cautious abscess in the location, then put it on the thing that causes the abscess or the inflammation; and let it be for several hours; and then strengthen with the bandages.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the bandages be of linen cloth of hemp or flax, and be formed wisely; or be of pine wood; or of palm branches; and let the width of each bandage be according to this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is fitting that the bandage that is put on that fracture be a bit thicker and wider than the other bandages, and the length of the bandage according to what is suitable for the limb in size and smallness; and then strengthen with the bandages another bandage according to your first tightness; and then loosen it above with a thread decently as we have said regarding tightness, and that should be your tightness according to the location of the fracture itself, and the more it is away from the fracture, the looser the tightness.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the threads be of medium thickness and fineness, and be made of soft material; and if the threads are too thick, as has been seen in the operation of certain foolish surgeons who use threads of twisted cord, it is a great mistake, when the tension should be equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And also very thin threads are not convenient, because you will not achieve with tension what you want, and it is not necessary that between this and that there be more than a finger's width.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is treated by applying tension to the extremities of the limbs, then apply it in those places, afterwards place padding made of cotton or flannel so that it does not cause injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Certain complicated fractures are with a wound, and accidents occur in the joint, and I will come back to the memory of it in that chapter according to specificity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that every broken limb is not reduced with splints on the first day; the reason for this is that the limb, when it is large, does not require being immobilized by splints unless after some days or weeks or months, according to the security of the appearance of abscess or caution.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of the ancient splint-makers by which the Ancients restored them, which were applied to fractures and dislocations and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	The treatment for a plaster cast for a fracture restoration is suitable for complex wounds and especially for women and children, because it is about something on which no heat or cold is applied: and it is that you take powder of mulberry, and it is the marrow of the flour that you should remove from the movement of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And refine that dough as it is, but rather sift it with a sieve of wool, and pause the preparation of it not rough nor subtle; then use that refined one.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another treatment for plaster cast restoration of fracture and dislocation and torsion: recipe of asafoetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, and myrrh, which is extracted from wild mint, all of one dram; of mirra and aloen one dram and a half; of alochil one dram and two scruples; all crushed and sifted and mixed with water or with wool if the preparation of the patient is ulcerated; then use this plaster, because it is of good composition and restores the broken bones gently, and comforts many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another treatment for plaster which you prepare for a fracture and torsion: recipe myrrh and half a dram of white altea, one dram and a half; of mirra and of aloen one dram and a half; of acacia one dram and six scruples; of Armenian bol one dram and twenty.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Let all things be crushed in a mortar with a motivated contraction, and be sieved, and be mixed with water or with white of egg and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Manipulation of plaster to joints and separated bones from their places, and sudden pain happens in those and in cracks and fractures: take a woolen cloth and submerge it in warm oil and vinegar and place it on the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	More than this plaster is not the virtue of restoration, but rather to cauterize and expel pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another manipulation of plaster that restores broken bones: take flour of dried fig and flour of wild poppy; mix everything and make a plaster from it.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Manipulation of quick plaster administered for the restoration of bone fracture and when you want resolution of the remaining swelling: take roots of lavender, of chamomile and flowers of violets, flour of peas, and all in equal part; let everything be crushed and mixed with wine, if the member is not scalded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scalded, then mix that with water of colic or humid water and apply it to the area.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another manipulation of plaster more strong in resolution than the first one, when there is a hard swelling for the restoration of the member: take roots of lavender and seeds of lin, and balustia, and melilot, marjoram, flowers of violet, of chamomile, all in equal part; let everything be crushed and mixed with water of sage or warm water or wine, according to the quality of the member and the rest of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	According to the great Hippocrates, do not apply anything on the third member except for restoration of it, unless made from wax and oil, and no other cause; and recommend that it be moderate between coarseness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	In Galen's opinion, it is seen that things are applied on the broken member for its restoration and the causes in which there is drying with little heat, as well as myrrh, and other seeds similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Manual of plaster that cures lesion and pain: take equally, of wax, of human skin or bear's hair, and of walnut, and salt, divided in equal parts; let them be ground and sieved, and then cooked, and make a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the quantity according to which you think that the ligament is broken and then dislocated, is that you consider if there isn't acute pain nor swelling nor the bone is fractured it doesn't move from its place, then you shouldn't dislocate it with forced movements.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there occurs at the place violent pain or swelling or inflammation, then you should restrain or dislocate it immediately, and apply its plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a cloth of linen and a marine sponge humidified with lemon, and submerge it in warm water, and with this wash the area where the discomfort and pain are located to soothe them; and then let the limb rest for an hour; and then apply a poultice made from oil or rose oil on the affected area submerged in vinegar or oil, and leave it on for nine hours until you are certain of reducing the swelling and letting the inflammation of the limb subside, and the pain be alleviated.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a thin and subtle plaster, not too tight for your primary construction, and subtly adjust it to the area until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if at times the abscess and redness and pain and inflammation and all accidents have been completely alleviated, and you no longer need a plaster or bandage, then apply in this way as you did from the beginning of the treatment.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of the causes we have mentioned affect the limb, then do not remove it, but leave it on for three or four or five or six days; and some times all that is left on for twenty days according to what seems right for the loosening of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and the coagulation of flesh forms over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	Then adjust the bandage more tightly in the upper part than in the lower part, and adjust it to the swelling of the patient's wound, according to how the memory of it is recalled.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you have already cleaned and reduced the area of the fracture more than is necessary, then be aware that nourishment is prohibited from reaching it; and so wrap it with cold water dressing, which has been watched over for three days; and loosen the bandage a little, and through this operation, restore nourishment to the limb, and it heals gently.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But those foolish restorers of the limb's fracture, who when it is not restored at the beginning, as is necessary, and it is restored according to its curvature, make a mistake in their procedure, and are filled with great fear, and if they were to increase the pain of the Ancients in their free writings and confess that they acted wrongly.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this before, for which it is more reasonable that they do not do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter following: On fractures that occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by a blow to the bone, and the blow strikes all the bone entering the siphac, which is called the bone, thus as it is said in the chest, and because of this the species is named "ascial"; or the blow cuts into one part of the bone, and cuts the flesh of it and does not pass the cut into the back of it; and this species of fracture is named "levatio absoluta".
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the wound of these two fractures is great or small, and the fracture that is confused or bruised; and its cause is a blow with a stone or a fall onto a rock, and similarly to this.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that approaches the peritoneum which is beside the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the wound of these two fractures is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And from fracture that is diminished in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair, and for this reason it is named this species hairline fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is made by a fall or by a blow of stone and similar things, which causes some layer of the bone to enter into the divided parts, and it is made in the concave place thus as accidents happen to the parcels of the brain when accidents happen due to blows and it is separation of their entrance into the divided parts.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And mostly it happens in the bodies of humid bones, like the heads of knees.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these species of fractures are called "suntagia", they are weights such as separated vertebrae.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come to the consideration of all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	We recognize all these species of fracture by detection on those and by inquiry of their pain and by feeling of corrupted flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	The species of hair-like fracture is known by the fact that it is discovered on the bone, and it is scraped off, and cleaned with a thread, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the cure of fractures consider at the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see by the accidents that they signify by manifest signification on fear, such as vomiting of anger, and extension, and loss of understanding, and absence of voice, and fainting, and acute fever, and distension of the veins and contraction of those, and similar things to them in the major conditions, it is doubtful if there will be healing.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see non-threatening accidents, then you hope for health, and so you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is that if it has come to you the wounded one at the beginning as it is wounded and this is in the days of winter, then it is necessary that you study on the feeling of the bone during the fourteenth day according to every condition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then it is necessary that you touch the bone on the seventh day, having that which is said the bone is corrupted by the panicle, and that the accidents that we have mentioned occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already penetrated to the pancreatic membrane covering the brain, and it is divided into thin and fragile parts, then it is necessary to sew the divided and fragile part together, according to what you have learned in your recommendations.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And that you shave the head of the patient plagued, and discover on the bone according to custom and manner as much as possible according to the figure of the plague, and that it be lighter for the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you need to make an incision on the bone, or a flow of blood or a cauterized abscess, then you oppose yourself to it with what is necessary, and that you fill the place with warm drinks and rose oil, and make the wound rest until the abscess is discharged, and you are secure from flows of blood; and then begin in the circle of the bone and in the removal of it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this will be according to one of the two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one manner is that you cut the bone with a cutter of strict so, and this is the shape of it: Then administer another cutter like this, a bit wider than that; and this is the shape of it:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer the largest cutter, wider than the previous one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is evident that you should be aware of the names of various incisions, some of which are longer than others; and some of these are shorter than others and are located at the end of the extremities, and are made of iron or felt.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion on the incision so that it does not strike the head and injure it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is hard and strong, then it is advisable that you perforate in the circumference of the tooth with instruments which you call non-deep trephines.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus but because those do not touch the term of the bone of the skull to that which is near it, so that the trephine has a round extremity or edge above that which is placed the head of the pointed instrument resembling an edge or a small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a large number of these trephines, each of which is suited to the thickness of each bone, while being present in the whole head of the skull, the extremity of which should be pointed, and the length and width should be according to the quantity of thickness of this head.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of trephines: The quality of perforating in the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the trephine on the bone and revolve it with the ties until you know that the bone is already penetrated; then return the trephine to another place, and pause there where everything is pierced the quantity of the thickness of the radius or environment.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert the incisors into the incisions that are between each hole of the bone, and make a very subtle pus on it with a touch of levity, as we have said, until you eradicate the bone, or with your hand, or for another cause due to various instruments which you will prepare for this purpose, like tweezers and subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And take care that you guard with all caution that the incision does not touch any part of the siphacium ( likely referring to a vital area, possibly the diaphragm or another sensitive internal organ).
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And thus when you have perforated the bone in a circle, and it is separated from the diaphragm if it is continuous with it, and you extract that part, take care to rasp and smooth it in the roughness of its surface, so that it is like the bone itself with another similar instrument to an incisor, but take care that it is more thin and more subtle than the other incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	If a small part of the bone is broken and cracked, then take it with ease as that which is necessary for your instruments; and then heal the wound with linen and apply the ointments that we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manual of operation is lighter, far from fear, which is called Gualia and is praised for its great ease; and this is its sermon: necessary for you at the beginning is to begin to discover the part of the bone in the location where the fracture is most vehement and most manifest, until when you have discovered that part and you have placed your hand on the extremity of this gentle and joyful incision, whose form is this:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that the lenticular part is smooth and does not cut any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides before in length, thus as veins; that the lenticular part be adjusted to the siphac with the face of the acute incision on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike on the incision of a part with a small hammer until you have cut all the bone with ease, as if it were revolving, and be sure of the pericardium that no accident will occur in the manner that you fear, and even if the doctor was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	When a cause is annexed to the bone of the pancreas in any location of the bone, it will affect that part of the body with the extremity of the incision, and it will facilitate the delivery of that which is obstructed, for it is obstructed by its own nocument and its own pain.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the pancreas, and that which is separated or stopped by the bone is the surface of it, and remains in its roughness and subtle scratches, then take care to scrape off that roughness and eradicate those subtle scratches with subtle scrapers, for which you have prepared the instrument, with various quantities so that you can administer them in any location, the most convenient for them and the most suitable for those according to what you understand from your operation on that broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And take care to administer in your scraper the one with which you scrape the bone from the beginning, the widest of those scrapers, and then use progressively the most subtle part of it, and do not cease to do this continually until you reach administering the thinnest and most subtle of all.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	In each of the other small fractures, capillary fractures and subtle fractures, take care to administer cure according to what you have understood for its correction.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	It is a cause that is not diminished on all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And it is based on what we have written, which has shown us in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the dressing is applied when you have extracted the bone, then take a cloth according to the quantity of the wound, and submerge it in rose oil, and apply it to the orifice of the wound; and take another doubled or tripled cloth and submerge it in wine and rose oil and apply it over the first cloth and do this as many times as you can without applying too much pressure on the dressing; and administer a latex dressing on it, and do not constrict it except for the quantity that the wound has, only just so.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave that on for the treatment for one day or two until you are sure of a mature abscess; and then remove it and administer medicines to those which have superfluous dryness, such as linseed and flour of vetches, and powder of anise and aristology, and similar things.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make from these medicines a powder that is dusted over the wound, as they are dry; and universally, administer on that all medicine of property such that it cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And beware that your skill ensures the plague in your cure is clean; and not in the surdity of ointment nor other; nor do you let virulence aggregate in it; for when it is adjusted on the panicle of the brain, it corrupts that and pours out that, and throws onto the patient a malignant malice.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it falls on the siphac of the head, as from it is mondified the bone and mainly when the cure of it is hindered, and is blackened on its surface; and then consider that if it falls to the patient the accidents that we have said, you should know that it is perilous to touch.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it doesn't fall blackness but from the medicine that is applied beneath, and it's in virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then take a part of honey and three parts of rose oil, and mix those with a cloth, and place that on the siphac; and place the cure with the species of cure that are convenient until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is fractured.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You should know that the nose is not broken but rather two parts together and above them, or one of those with some visible veins, because there are two bones in it, whereas the part below is cartilaginous, and it's not fractured but rather subject to bruising and twisting and bending.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	If one of the two parts of it is broken, then you should introduce the small tool into the nose, and you will bind that fracture with the same tool indicating the location, and with the same tool you will push from outside until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this for your convenience, and be careful that you do not fall during the operation on the patient's suffering.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and the tool does not reach it, then you should cut to the end of the rod on which the enlargement is placed.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same as for this.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And take care to restore it on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then apply the vinegar or the decoction of the healing plant to the rest of the aposteme.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then insert into the end of the nose a thread of linen cloth, if the fracture is in one part, or two threads, if the fracture is in two parts, and let it be in the thread enough quantity to fill the hole of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorers said that the threads should be soaked in borax, and should be applied throughout the day, but it is not seen by me; however, it is necessary that the thread be wrapped in a poultice of honey combined with powdered mallow; and then leave the thread until the bone is fixed and the cartilage is hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes insert into the nostrils certain warm compresses, in place of heat, a poultice made from a mixture of wool and lion's skin; and make sure that you have already applied the fracture of the nose strongly and that the patient is not prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want to, do it, and if you want to, apply warmth.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if a severe abscess or boil occurs, plaster the nose with wax or with a mixture of melted wax and rose oil, or with a diaculum.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if a severe abscess or boil does not occur, then take care to plaster the affected area with flour of euphorbia and powder of crushed almonds mixed with white album of egg; and place a poultice on the stoppage, and do not bind the nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are comminuted, then take care to split apart those, and extract those with instruments that are suitable for those; and place a bandage on the fissure, and cure it with water that nourishes and consolidates, and plaster it with what is conveniently applied.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if an ulcer occurs inside the nose, then take care to cure it with warmth and administer suppositories of lead until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter Four.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	On the restoration of the jaw when it is fractured.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture of it is not a serious wound, consider then if the fracture is only displaced and not broken in two and is curved to the separated parts within, then its union is easier.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And do this, if the fracture is on the right side, you will insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; and similarly if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert the right index finger of the right hand; and press with that the curvature of the fracture within to facilitate the displaced parts coming together, with your other hand on the outside of the bone; and gently move them so that they come together.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two parts, then it is necessary that you apply extension to both parts according to the correct method until it is possible to bring them together.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if it happens with the displacement of teeth to disruption, then hold those with which you expect to remain firm with a thread of gold or silver or silk; and place a bandage over the fractured jaw, and place a bandage over that one doubled, and place a large sterile cloth decently made, or a single piece of gauze along the length of the jaw; and tie this above according to what seems appropriate for the binding and what is convenient for the application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to use rest and tranquility, and stop the food that is harmful to them.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you think that the figure is already altered in some manner, then take it and separate it from the third day; and then rectify what has been altered of it and fill it with powder of moly, or album of egg, or flour of cypress, since you will have applied the cerate of it, and place on the plaster a woolen cloth.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then when the plaster is attached and adjusted on it, and the position of the bone is not altered, leave it, so that it is not removed until it is healed and the fracture is strengthened; for many times observed this fracture is strengthened in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another observed aposteme occurs, then administer what we have often said in the treatment of it until it is healed, and the aposteme is reduced.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with a wound, then consider if it is a piece of bone separated or fragmented, then you subtly remove those fragments with what is convenient for the remedy of those disturbances.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the edges of the wound are tight, then you enlarge it with a flea-cut according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then return the injured part to its original state, and if it is not fully restored, place a suitable plaster on that area and attach it so that it adheres until it heals.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the hernia when it is strained.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	When the hernia is ruptured in the division before the navel, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	When it is ruptured, or separated, or separated into two parts that do not touch the surrounding tissues; and it is easier to restore; or it is such that it touches the surrounding tissues, and it is difficult to restore; or it is such that the fracture is in the wound.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation on it, when the fracture is in the wound, is that you have two assistants present, so that one holds the adjunct and follows the ruptured hernia, and the other stretches out the skin with that division.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then shape the fracture with your fingers until its form is made according to what is suitable, and it should not be in a prominent or hollow place.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then it is suitable that you place a piece of cloth or linen under the patient's thigh, and its size should be according to the quantity of your need; and stretch and elevate the hernia and tie the cloth with your hand until it shapes the fracture as is suitable.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot reach the extremity of the furcula to the divided parts in front, because it has come to the pubic area, then it is necessary that the patient be placed on their back, and a cushion be put on the muscle of their thigh, in its middle part.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister presses the muscle of their thigh at the divided parts until the bone of the furcula is elevated that is in the pubic area in its place, and then you correct the fracture and bind it with ties to the thighs.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	More often if you feel stagnations of the furcula and they are swollen, then it is necessary that you make an incision over that area and extract those stagnations with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you make an incision on it with one of the incision tools that you have prepared for this purpose, since you had previously placed the furcula under the instrument that serves the ciphac; and the instrument is made of wood or iron, of which this is the form:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a spoon, of which this is the concavity; and let its width be according to what you need from it, according to the size of the bone or the smallness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Measure the length of it according to what is possible for the operation; that it should have two extremities thus at times, and one extremity should be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound that you have made when you extracted the abscess from the bone is wide, and there is a risk of gathering pus, then adjust the two lips of the wound with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear gathering pus, then fill the wound with dressings and poultices according to the quantity of the split of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if there is a gathering of pus, then put on a dressing made with sour wine and rose oil, and apply it to that area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the bone is wounded and fractured, it is that you put a plaster made from wheat flour mixed with white of egg, and apply it to the swollen area, and then apply the splint of the patient's own shirt, if indicated for that, and then take a bandage, which is a long strip, and its width should be about one palm or so; and apply double poultices over the swollen area and the plaster; and take a thin sheet of tablecloth, whose width is three fingers and length similarly; and wrap that in a dressing, and wrap that dressing with the sheet in the place on the place of the fracture; and apply bandage as it is wound, and wind that around the patient's neck and their good arm, and their patient's bad arm, and reduce that all over the affected part, and whenever the constriction of the fractured area decreases, and this is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And you must ensure that the steel is not rubbed against the broken bone; and for this reason, as you visit the patient every day, when the ligament is softened or the steel has been reapplied, then you correct this and strengthen the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then you stop the patient's sleep by their neck, and place a small cushion under their arm in the night, so that when they are elevated by the assistant on that side, thus the fracture of the shoulder is elevated to the elevation of the muscle; or their arm is tied to the neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not untie the binding unless there is an abscess or apostema in the area, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then you renew the plaster if you have seen the face of it to that effect, and adjust in the constriction and restore it, and let it be until it is restored and the fracture of the shoulder is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the month in 28 days, and some visits are made at home in less than a month's time of that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	On the restoration of the fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The flat spatula is broken in the left side and it is not the breakage of it, but rather its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And thus when the place of it is broken — and it is broken in the middle of its place — and not joined except by touch, then according to the shape of the fracture prepare it and reduce it according to its natural shape in every manner of art that is at your disposal.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then apply a poultice of ground album of egg to the place, and stop it with a linen cloth; and apply dust of double-folded cloth; and apply on it a subtle plaster made of table or mortar according to the quantity of the spatula, all or a little more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the plaster is concave in some of the places of the spatula, then you should fill that concavity with a linen cloth, and apply the plaster equally.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then strengthen it with a long bandage from constricted binding and from firmness of the plaster, so that it does not move from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And check the dressing every day; and all visits that it should be softened, remove another visit and strengthen it and adjust the plaster if it has moved from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And let the patient lie on their side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in twenty days or in twenty-five.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And then when the name is completed, you dissolve the ligament, and you should be assured that the dissolution is not of the bones, but rather of the cartilage, which is not a serious or worrisome condition.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the place of the bone to the skin and put a plaster on it, then cut above it, and remove the splinter, and do as we have said in the treatment of the fracture with a hot poultice of emollient, or apply a cautery if it becomes necessary here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of the fracture of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot, having been broken in the middle part of it, and this causes a deformation; but the extremities of the movement are not deformed, rather they are shaken and dislocated.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents of it, when the middle of it is broken, it is that it declines to the inner parts and causes great pain, and difficulty in walking, and coughing, and vomiting blood; and it is declared in the cavity in the broken bone and is not hidden from feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient should be placed on their back, and a cushion under their shoulders; and apply pressure to the muscles of it, and adjust the ribs of it with the hands of two assistants, and proceed subtly in the operation and in the adjustment according to all manner that is possible and convenient for it, until the shape of the bone returns as it should be.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then pause on the plaster and stop and pause above the subtle table of sauce or of warm poultice and of its similar things in lightness, since you envelop that in a cloth; and then subtly apply it to the broken bone so it's not dislocated; and go with the bandage according to the condition of the back some dressed wounds, and strengthen that with a strict dressing; and then consider the bandage at all times, and when it is softened, strengthen it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity provokes a detachment of that which causes corrosion or rubbing, or pain, or abscess that occurs in the area, then touch and detach that and eradicate the plaster and rectify what occurs with the hand of skill of cure of it; and then reduce the plaster, if at times it adheres to the face; and adjust to it the strictness within which it will be healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 3.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the ribs when they are fractured.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that a fracture of the ribs does not occur except in coarse locations that are near the back; and of their extremities, from the partition in front, nothing occurs to those contrary but because they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	The recognition of it is not hidden from the sensation that guides the examination of it with the fingers.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be such that it reduces the fracture with the fingers according to the possible method, until it is reduced as it should be, and then apply a plaster and strengthen the broken bone with steel, if necessary for that.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs is declining into the partitions of the dent, then it happens to the patient vehement pain and puncture, like the puncture that happens to one who has pleurisy, and for this reason the bone puts on inflammation; and it happens difficulty in breathing, and coughing, and vomiting of bloody mucus; and this is of difficult cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the medicines are prepared for that with many preparations.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And of it they say: it is good that you give the patient foods that cause inflammation and swelling, so that the belly is inflated and extended, and the fracture is pushed away from the affected parts.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We would have avoided this for what is not a trivial cause to generate a cold abscess, if it does not happen; and if it already happens, then it already helps with that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they said some of them that the ventosa should be given and also that it should suck with strength; and it seems reasonable, but however it is feared that the ventosa will attract the superfluities to the place due to weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	They will say some of these: that the place should be covered with wool that has already been submerged in hot oil, and powders should be placed between the ribs until it is filled, which should be the binding plaster when you envelop the aforementioned retortion; and the patient should be treated with a cure of pleurisy of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the cause creates severe constriction for the patient who cannot breathe, and the bone presses on the vein with a sharp puncture, they should place a bandage over the patient, then they should make an incision on the place, uncovering the broken rib, and place their hand on that instrument which holds the diaphragm in place, the memory of which is preceded, and they should facilitate the bone, and extract that thing.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with a suture, and treat it with plasters until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if an abscess forms, then cut it and pour powders in heated rose oil and apply to the place, and the patient should be treated with what is suitable for the internal abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And let him rest on the side where he sleeps, until he is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter nine.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the spine and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some wounds imply fracture to the bones of the neck, and similarly injure them, and likewise to the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when this happens to someone and you want to know if they will be healed or not, then consider this: for if the muscles are already softened and numbed and deadened and cannot be moved or stretched or strengthened, and when you constrict them with your fingers or prick them with a needle, you don't feel pain in them, then you should know that it is not curable, and in such cases it is often fatal.
